The building company which operates nearby his house pays the rental fee to him because that part of land belongs to him. His son makes his living from a sales business. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase an electric car. Electric cars contribute to cleaner air in cities because they produce no harmful pollution at the tailpipe from the onboard source of power, such as particulates (soot), volatile organic compounds, hydrocarbons, carbon monoxide, ozone, lead, and various oxides of nitrogen. His main purpose for purchasing an electric car is to render taxi services to local people as an additional income source because his family needs aren't met with their income. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an electric car.

loans.name: Jose Rumaldo

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 14 y 15 años, también un nieto. El se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos, crianza de cerdos y aves de corral; este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres desde muy pequeño, hoy en día son sus hijos los que le ayudan a llevarlo a cabo, la ventaja que tiene es que la cosecha es ayuda para la familia y para venderla.
El crédito que requiere le permitira comprar abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas, pesticidas y asimismo para adquirir concentrado para los cerdos; este le ayudara a obtener una mejor cosecha en el cultivo y uno de los riesgos seria un invierno escaso de lluvia.
Su sueño es darle una mayor calidad de vida a su familia y aspira tener ganado en el futuro para así obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and two children, ages 14 and 15. He also has a grandchild. José cultivates basic grain crops and also raises pigs and poultry. He learned this trade from his parents at a very young age. Today his children help him carry out his work. This is advantageous during harvest time since his family helps him with gathering and selling the crops.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as concentrated feed for his pigs. This will help him obtain a better harvest from his crops. One of the risks that he must deal with would be the lack of rain during the winter.

His dream is to provide a better quality of life for his family, so he aspires to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, fungicides, herbicides, pesticides, as well as concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a farmer aged 45 and married. His family lives at Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. Elsie and his wife plant and harvest rice to sell. Elsie usually gains about 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) each harvest season. Their income supplements their daily food intake, other daily expenditures in their house such as the electric bill, and school fees. Elsie wanted to gain more income and improve crop growth; that is why he is now asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming activity. Elsie hopes to maintain a fruitful harvest for the overall welfare of his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for his farming activity.

loans.name: Elsie's Group

texts.en:
Elsie is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Matugas Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Elsie is has a snack and food selling business.  She earns approximately 1,500 PHP each month. 

Elisie is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to redeem her pawned parcel cocoland. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.  

Elsie is the leader of a two-person group.  Each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To be used in redeeming their pawned parcel cocoland

loans.name: Hussain

texts.en:
Hussain is an Iraqi youth client who is 18 years old and lives with his family of 5 members. Hussain and his father work to provide the family income.

Hussain runs a small business. He owns a small grocery store where he provides the needs of his neighborhood. He sells various products such as dairies, diapers, snacks, canned food and detergents. He has been in this field since 2009 and is gradually growing with fame and respect. 

Hussain is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his grocery store in order to attract more customers. Hussain believes that this loan will change his current financial condition and will give him the ability to assist his father in providing the school fees of his other 4 brothers.

loans.use: to renovate his grocery store

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar, age 32, owns a small farm where he raises cows and sells dairy products. This was his father's farm, and he learned the business from a young age by helping his father. Haydar took over the business in 2007. It has since grown and has gained a strong reputation in the area, thanks to the high quality of the goods Haydar offers.

Haydar and his wife have three children. He is the sole breadwinner for his family, and he works hard to provide for them.
 
Haydar is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,400 USD in order to buy a cow to increase his production. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  She runs a variety store within her locality, which she has been doing for 12 years. Her husband works as a farmer.The couple aspires to improve their sources of income.

Jovelyn is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, detergent soap and soft drinks. She plans to have stocks of commodities in her store so that she can lessen her transportation expenses going to and from the market.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items such as eggs, cooking oil, detergent soap, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Operating a 'bibingka' (rice cake) business is what Jocelyn does for a living. She is from Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. At the age of 59, she busies herself rearing her four children.

From her snack business, Jocelyn earns about PHP  6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to buy flour and other ingredients to cook 'bibingka.'

Jocelyn has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to have a bigger business venture and to expand to a greater variety of snacks.

loans.use: to buy flour and other ingredients to cook 'bibingka'

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Yelica

texts.es: La Sra. Yelica  sigue con la actividad de la elaboración y venta de pan cuenta que le va muy bien,  el anterior crédito lo utilizo en la compra de horno  para la elaboración de pan y empanadas,  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos para la elaboración de pan como azúcar y harina, por mayor, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelica continues her business of making and selling bread, which is doing very well. Her previous loan was used to buy an oven for making bread and empanadas. She grew her business and increased her clientele, which resulted in more income.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy supplies for making bread, such as sugar and flour in bulk. Yelica is pleased and appreciative of this new opportunity that has been given to her.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar in bulk.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 20 años,está casada y tiene 1 hijo pequeño con quien vive en la casa de sus suegros.Angélica se dedica a la confección ya que aprendió este oficio de su madre quien reparaba las prendas de vestir a sus clientes , sin embargo, empezó a afianzar esta actividad en la casa de su suegra ya que ella también se dedica a la costura desde hace muchos años. Trabaja actualmente en el taller que ambas comparten y se encarga de crear diversas prendas de vestir de hermosos diseños para ponerlas a la venta. Lleva dedicándose de lleno a la costura y espera seguir cumpliendo su labor con mucha responsabilidad.Le gusta su trabajo pues le genera muy buenos ingresos económicos los cuales usa para  pagar los gastos de su hogar. Tiene planeado ampliar y mejorar su negocio comprando una máquina de coser semi industrial.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segunda de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de costura como telas, hilos, elásticos, encajes y licra para que continúe confeccionando prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Angelica is 20 years old, she is married, she has a small son, and they live with her in-laws.  Angelica makes her living by sewing and she learned this job from her mother who repairs clothing for her customers. Angelica began her business while working at her in-law's house, since her mother-in-law has also been working as a seamstress for many years. They now share the studio where they make diverse garments of beautiful designs and then sell them.  She is dedicated to her work and always strives to complete her work responsibly.

She likes to work because it enables her to generate a good income which she uses to pay the household expenses. In order to grow and improve her business, she wants to buy a semi-industrial sewing machine.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support, as she feels like this is necessary to move her business forward.  At the same time, she promises to comply with punctual payments.  She will use this loan to buy the materials she needs such as fabric, thread, elastic, lace, and lycra so that she can continue making garments.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing such as fabric, thread, elastic, and more.

loans.name: 3 Lovely Group

texts.en:
Leny is the featured borrower of 3 Lovely Group. She is the one seated in the middle. She went along with the other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, because they have always been friends since they came to work in Lebanon as housekeepers to improve their living.

Leny is a 53-year-old, divorced woman, mother of one child. She works as a housekeeper to make her living and to provide her only child at least the minimum standards of living anyone needs, although she works hard to provide him with the best. 

Leny’s applied-for loan will be sent to her child back in the Philippines to cover his social and financial needs. She hopes that one day she will save a good amount of money that will help her open her own business and reunite with her son.

Angelie is the one seated at the right. She is a 32-year-old, single woman who works as a housekeeper to support her family back in the Philippines. Her applied-for loan will be sent to her brother for his medical expenses.

Lenie is a 20-year-old, single woman who works as a housekeeper, too. Her applied-for loan will be invested in covering some of her sudden and urgent family needs.

loans.use: to send money to her son to cover his needs.

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
Wilian tiene 40 años de edad. Tiene cinco años de dedicarse a la crianza de aves de corral; lo aprendió de un tío ya que él le ayudaba a la crianza de estas aves. Antes Wilian, elaboraba ladrillo de barros y vendía periódicos en las calles. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 quintales de concentrado y 150 pollos. Con el dinero seguirá con su negocio de pollos de engorde que le deja bastante rentabilidad y con la cual cubre los gastos de su familia. Su objetivo, es instalarle el techo a la galera y cementar el piso en donde mantiene a los pollos.
texts.en:
Willian is 40 years old and has been raising poultry for five years. He learned this trade from his uncle since he was the one who helped him raise these birds. Prior to this, Willian manufactured clay bricks and also sold newspapers on the streets.

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy 10 quintales (1 quintal = 100 kg) of concentrated feed and 150 chickens. With this money, Willian will be able to continue his poultry business so that it generates an adequate profit to cover his family’s expenses. His goal is to install a roof and a cement floor in the chicken coop so that he can maintain the birds.

loans.use: to buy 150 chickens and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Juana Bautista

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Juana en su negocio de fabricación de escobas, ella logró aumentar su producción porque con su credikiva su volumen de compras fue mayor y ahora su negocio está creciendo. Ella dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “Gracias por apoyar a los emprendedores Colombianos”
Su crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materiales exclusivamente en paja y maderas para elaborar prácticas escobas y que su clientela esté satisfecha, convirtiendo su credikiva una vez más, en una inversión muy exitosa.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Juana's business making brooms. She was able to increase her production because with her previous Kiva loan she purchased raw materials at a greater volume and her business is now growing. She tells her Kiva lenders, "Thank you for supporting Colombian entrepreneurs."

Her loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for the exclusive use of straw and wood so that she can make brooms and her clientele will be satisfied. This will make her Kiva loan once again a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy straw and wood materials to make practical brooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish paying for her house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 51 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Pobalacion, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Gloria sells clothes, which she has been doing  for 20 years. She earns 3,500 PHP a month. 

Gloria is requesting a loan from PMPC for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more clothes to sell.  In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 46 years old, married, and has four children.  She lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Flora works in the fish industry, selling fish for living, which she has been doing for 20 years. 

Flora is requesting a loan from PMPC, which she will use to buy more fish to sell.  In the future, Flora hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Giseth Margarita

texts.es:
Giseth de 48 años de edad se dedica a la fabricación de calzado en materiales como cuero y aplicando lindos accesorios que hacen que su trabajo sea de mayor calidad.
Su experiencia data de hace 16 años cuando decidió poner al servicio de su clientela su experiencia en la elaboración de calzado y bolsos y desde allí no se ha detenido y ha aumentado su calidad así como su clientela.  En su negocio tiene vendedoras que ofrecen su producto mediante muestras que ella les suministra para ofrecerlas en el mercado. Ella vende y compra en efectivo y sus principales clientes son los vendedores, quienes solicitan productos (bolsos y calzado) y a los cuales debe responder de manera oportuna, para continuar creciendo como es su meta. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cueros, accesorios, forros y sintéticos con los cuales diseñará nuevos productos, como bolsos y calzados, para impactar cada vez mas su mercado y hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Giseth is 48 years old and makes footwear using materials such as leather. She applies pretty accessories for a higher quality. She was been a cobbler for 16 years, when she decided to make her expertise in the manufacture of footwear and handbags available to her customers. Since then she has not stopped, and continues to increase the quality of her products and number of customers. In her store, she employs sales assistants who offer samples of her products to the market. She buys and sells in cash and her main customers are sellers who order products (bags and shoes). She trys to respond to demand in a timely manner, in order to continue growing, which is her goal. 

This is precisely why she has turned to credikiva. This is her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which she will buy leather, accessories, linings and synthetic fabrics, to design new products, such as handbags and footwear, to have an increasing impact on her market, and to make her credikiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy leather, accessories, lining and synthetic fabrics.

loans.name: Carlton

texts.en:
Carlton has owned and operated C.D. Construction in Birmingham, Ala. for 12 years. He and his four full-time and two part-time employees specialize in home improvements such as roofing, construction, deck and fence building, remodels, and new construction. To accommodate a growing business, Carlton needed to lease a building to store his construction materials and his tools. 

Despite his many years of experience, a steady flow of clientele, and his truck as collateral, Carlton said he had difficulty acquiring a loan to pay for his storage building. 

“I tried five banks and they all turned me down,” Carlton said. 

One day while Carlton was visiting City Hall in Birmingham, he told a representative at the Office of Economic Development about his challenges. The representative referred him to Accion Texas Inc. Though Carlton was happy to learn about this opportunity, he had some apprehensions about applying for a loan again. “It gets to the point where you feel like you’re going to be turned down again and you get tired of trying,” he said. 

But he said he was pleasantly surprised at how simple and easy it was to acquire his $5,000 loan.  “It went so smoothly, I was shocked,” Carlton said. “I never expected it to go through as smoothly as it did. I tell everybody it’s the greatest experience and you need to go to Accion.”

Carlton used the funds to assist with business expenses, office equipment, a storage facility for materials and supplies, and salaries for his employees.  Carlton stressed the importance of employee retention for his company and assured a portion of the loan funds will go to salaries. The loan allowed Carlton’s company to save and store needed materials instead of discarding them or risk ruining them while they were left outside.  

The company currently has a steady flow of customers and Carlton is excited about his future.  The Accion loan has allowed him to further his dream and continue to grow. He said he plans to quickly pay off his loan so he can build his credit and finance other business expansion projects. 

“The loan I received from Accion helped me so much,” Carlton said. “I appreciate it so much and am just so grateful to God that somebody gave me this opportunity.”

loans.use: to pay business expenses, buy office equipment, a storage facility for materials and supplies, and pay salaries for his employees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish paying for her house.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar, age 54, lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, with his wife, son, and daughter in-law. The family owns a small plot of agricultural land, where they grow greens and a few vegetables for their personal use. Nugzar is currently working for a local aircraft construction company as an artisan and receives a small monthly salary.

Nugzar and his family would like to start a family dairy farm business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up capital, but without success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 
 
Nugzar is now requesting a loan from Credo to start up the family business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With his loan funds, Nugzar will purchase a milk cow. His wife will milk the cow daily and the family will produce dairy products that will be sold among the local people. In this way, the family will earn an additional income.  

This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Whylyn

texts.en: Whylyn is 33 years old and lives in Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with 2 children. Whylyn has a new business selling a variety of rice. She has requested a loan for additional capital to buy sacks of rice to resell. Whylyn has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Whylyn would like to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice for resale

location.town: Liloy - Antonino, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen is 36 years old, married with five children and they are reside in Tacdog, Siquijor.

He has owned a sari-sari (convenience store) business for 25 years and earns 9000 PHP a month to support his family's daily needs.

He has been a PMPC member for two years and now has requested a loan amounting to 30000 PHP to purchase different products for his store and to continue operating his business.

loans.use: to purchase different products for his sari-sari (convenience) store

loans.name: Triyiphina

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 59-year-old Triyiphina from Bulawayo. She is single with two children, both attending school. Triyiphina runs a manufacturing business producing mainly knitwear, which includes jerseys, woolen hats and baby wear. She also does cross border trading. The business has been in operation for 10 years. She says the main challenges faced are competition and the high cost of raw materials. Triyiphina has requested a loan of $500 (USD) to buy more raw materials of wool, thread and sewing fabric to make jerseys and other winter wear. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to pay school fees for her grandchildren, who she takes care of.  In the future, Triyiphina plans to buy more state-of-the-art equipment for use in her workshop so that she can stay current with new trends in fashion changes. She also plans to open a small factory shop near town.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her sewing business including wool, sewing fabric, and sewing thread.

loans.name: Sienna

texts.en:
Sienna is 40 years old, married with three children, two in school and the other an infant. They are living in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor.

She had a retail business for one year and earns PHP 1000 a month to help support her family's needs. Now, she has requested a loan amounting to PHP 3000 to be used as additional capital to buy different goods to sell.

She's a new member of PMPC and hopes to show the best performance she can.

loans.use: to purchase different goods to buy and sell

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz, age 27, lives in the district of Sagarejo. He intends to open a family grocery store business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up capital, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Currently, Teimuraz lives with his parents. His mother is a teacher in the local kindergarten, earning a small monthly salary, and his father is a retired policeman who is able to provide the family with additional income from his pension. 
 
Teimuraz has requested a loan from Credo to start up his grocery business. He has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income. 

With his credit, Teimuraz will purchase grocery stocks and open his store. He is a very hard-working man and intends to fulfill all the business needs for the shop himself. This will decrease his expenses and increase his profit. 

Part of the profit from Teimuraz's new venture will be reinvested back into the business, in order to expand the variety of the shop's product inventory. The rest will be used for improving the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase grocery stocks and open a grocery shop

loans.name: Ermelinda Del Carmen

texts.es: Ermelinda, es originaria de Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí. Inicio su negocio de pulpería hace 30 años a la edad de 16 años, cuando vendió una bicicleta, con el dinero obtenido compro un poco de mercadería, con lo que iba vendiendo fue surtiendo poco a poco su negocio, luego obtuvo dinero para comprar. Estos han sido los únicos negocios a los que se ha dedicado. En su negocio la apoyan su esposo. Su producto lo comercializa en su localidad lo que es pulpería y en las comunidades aledañas lo que es venta de ropa ambulante. No tiene otras La expectativas que tiene de su negocio es que crezca para surtirlo y aumentar sus ventas, diversifícalo con ropa y calzado. El préstamo lo solicito para la compra de mercadería; arroz, aceite, jabón, manteca, maíz, productos de limpieza. Este crédito le ayudara a crecer su negocio porque comprara mercadería para surtirlo e incrementar sus ventas. Sus planes futuros son ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ermelinda is originally from Pueblo Nuevo, Estelí.  She started her own convenience store 30 years ago, when she was 16.  After selling her bicycle, she used the profits to buy a small amount of merchandise that she sold little by little.  As she did so, she gradually built up her business and eventually had enough money to buy more merchandise.

This is the only business that she has had.  Her husband supports her in her business.  She sells her goods in the local community and also sells clothing as a street vendor in surrounding communities.  She expects her business to grow and hopes to do so so she can increase her sales and  inventory (adding clothes and shoes to her wares).

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise such as rice, oil, soap, lard, corn, and cleaning products.  This loan will help her to grow her business, since she will be able to buy additional merchandise to increase her sales.  Her future plans include expanding her business and making home improvements.

loans.use: buy merchandise, including rice, oil, soap, lard, corn, and cleaning products.

loans.name: Shahriniso

texts.ru: Шахринисо 49 лет. Она замужем и живет с мужем, сыном и дочерью в районе Спитамен. Шахринисо работает воспитательницей в детском саде, а ее муж зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. Их заработок едва хватает на семейные расходы. Шахринисо решила улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Она намерена начать новый бизнес и выбрала сферу животноводства - куплю-продажу крупнорогатого скота. У нее имеется коровник для содержания скота. Шахринисо запрашивает кредит для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота с целью дальнейшего их откорма и продажи. В этом биизнесе ей будет помогать семья.
texts.en:
Shahriniso is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, son and daughter in the Spitamen region. Shahriniso works as a kindergarten teacher, and her husband earns a living providing taxi services. Their pay is barely enough for family expenses. 

Shahriniso decided to improve the financial situation of the family. She intends to start a new business and chose the sphere of animal husbandry - buying and selling cattle. She has a barn for keeping the livestock. 

Shahriniso is requesting a loan for the purchase of two heads of cattle in order to further fatten and resell them. In this business, she will help her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 35 years old and lives in Tawi-Tawi Aloran, Misamis, Occidental. She is married and has two school-age children.
Juditha has a sari-sari (convenience) store business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month. She has a requested a loan to use for home improvements.
Juditha has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Juditha hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married with two children. Marieta is 52 years old and lives in Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City.
Marieta is engaged in buying & selling to earn a living and has had this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 for additional capital for her business of buying & selling whole coconuts.
Marieta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Marieta hopes to have more savings and wants to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to buy and sell coconuts.

location.town: Oroquieta-Tui-an Dolipos Bajo, Oroq., Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Lamzira

texts.en:
Lamzira is 50 years old. She lives in Kutaisi District with her sons (13 and 15 years old). Lamzira requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is small monthly transfers from Lamzira’s husband, who is working abroad.  

Lamzira requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit, Lamzira will purchase household goods from the big market in the capital city at wholesale prices. She will bring them to her district and sell among the villagers with a price markup. This will give her an opportunity to earn additional income for the family. She will use part of the profit for reinvesting in the same business, to purchase more stock of household goods. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To start trading in household goods.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 52 years old. She lives in the small village of Gurjaani District in the Kakheti Region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and father-in-law. Nino requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Nino’s father-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard. They pick grapes seasonally and sell locally at a good price. In addition, Nino works as a nurse at a kindergarten locally and has a small monthly salary. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Nino requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With this credit Nino will begin trade with fruits and dairy products. She will purchase these products at wholesale prices and then resell with a price markup. This will increase the income of their family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to begin trade with fruits and dairy products.

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a married Iraqi client, who is 50 years old and has five children. Yasin and two of his children provide the family income together.

Yasin is a grocer. He provides his neighborhood with fresh dairy products, snacks, drinks, and tissue paper. He established his business in 2010 and now he has an employee hired. Yasin gained good experience in this field and is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. 

He is requesting a loan of USD 3,000. The aim of this loan is to renovate the grocery store and to buy a motor generator. 

Yasin aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so that, one day, he may open a bigger supermarket and provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the grocery store and to buy a motor generator.

loans.name: Ketilut

texts.es: Ketilut tiene 36 años, es una mujer emprendedora y amante del trabajo, tiene 3 hijos de 19, 10 y 3 años de edad respectivamente con quienes vive en su casa propia.Ketilut se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, condimentos, embutidos, leche, huevos, bebidas, golosinas y otros. Todos los días desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su tienda para atender a sus clientes que llegan en busca de algún producto con la seguridad que ahí encontrarán lo que necesitan. Su tienda es la más surtida de su zona y sus clientes no dudan en comprarle, no solo por la calidad del producto sino por el buen trato que ofrece. Lleva en este negocio 10 años y siempre recibe la ayuda de su cónyuge e hijos.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y verlos empezar el día con una sonrisa.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000 y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, huevos, fideos, verduras, frutas y otros artículos.
texts.en:
Ketilut is 36 years old. She has an entrepeneurial spirit and loves working. She has 3 children aged 19, 10 and 3 years old who live with her in her home. 

Ketilut sells food and drinks such as rice, sugar, spices, meats, milk, eggs, sweets, and much more. She opens her shop from the early hours of the morning every day to serve customers who come looking for a product knowing they will find what they need. 

Her store is the best stocked in the area and her customers are very happy to shop there, not only for the quality of her products, but also for the reasonable prices she offers. She has been in business for 10 years and she is helped by her husband and children. Her favourite part of the job is chatting to her customers and seeing they start their day with a smile. 

This time she will ask for a loan of 2000 PEN and is grateful for the financial support so she is able to continue moving forward. With the requested amount she will buy more food such as rice, sugar, eggs, noodles, vegetables, fruit and other items.

loans.use: To buy staple foods such as rice, sugar, eggs, pasta etc.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es: Don Iván mejor conocido como el ‘’Doc’’ en su comunidad tiene una farmacia de productos botánicos en el barrio donde vive, es originario de Estelí le gusta hacer labor comunitaria   porque tuvo una historia triste en su juventud le costó mucho poder logara una carrera universitaria y es por eso que ayuda a los jóvenes  en riesgo don Iván nos cuenta que el crédito le ayudó mucho a salir adelante porque gracias a eso pudo comprar más productos y su negocio creció. Este nuevo crédito lo está solicitando para comprar medicina al por mayor  tales como omega 3, reductores  peso, batidos naturales, shampo para caída de cabello, canelas etc. Su meta a futuro es que su farmacia siga creciendo piensa en hacerle mejoras a su vivienda para darle más espacio a negocio su meta próxima es comprar los productos que necesita para crecer él está muy agradecido con MiCrédito y Kiva por la ayuda que ha recibido.
texts.en: Iván, better known as "Doc" in his community, has a botanical products pharmacy in the neighborhood where he lives. He is a native of Estelí. He likes to do community work, because the story of his youth was sad. It took a lot for him to be able to achieve a university education, and that is why he helps at-risk youth. Iván tells us that the loan helped him a lot to move ahead because thanks to it he was able to buy more products and his business grew. He is asking for this new loan to buy wholesale medicine such as omega 3, weight loss products, natural shakes, shampoo for hair loss, cinnamon, etc. His goal in the future is for his pharmacy to keep growing. He is thinking of making improvements to his house to give his business more room. His next goal is to buy the products he needs in order to grow. He is very grateful to MiCrédito and Kiva for the help he has received.

loans.use: to buy wholesale medicine such as omega 3, weight loss products, natural shakes, shampoo for hair loss, cinnamon, etc

loans.name: Melanea

texts.es: Doña Melania vive en la ciudad de Estelí desde hace cuatro años ella empezó en el negocio de pulpería,   porque su mamá le enseñó desde muy pequeña  a trabajar ya que ellas eran de escasos recursos vendían tortillas en la calle y siempre le ha gustado el negocio entonces ella con sus ahorros decidió poner su pequeña pulpería compró diez libras de arroz cinco litros de aceite, café y pan y así fue comprando poco a poco ella tiene como expectativa seguir creciendo está ubicada en un buen punto de venta cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su hijo adolecente el cual está estudiando y es la razón que la impulsa a seguir adelante. Solicita este crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, maíz, frijoles, gaseosas y golosinas productos básicos para la venta.  Sus planes futuros son mejorar la condición de su vivienda y la venta agregando  productos nuevos  para vender.
texts.en:
Melania lives in the city of Estelí, and four years ago she opened a small grocery store.  Her mother taught her to work from a young age, and since they were of limited resources they sold tortillas on the street.  Since she always enjoyed business, she decided to use her savings to open her small grocery store. She started by buying ten pounds of rice, five liters of oil, coffee and bread, and little by little she kept buying goods.  

She hopes to continue growing as her store is in a good selling location.  She counts on the support of her husband and teenage son, who is currently in school, and is the reason for her strive to succeed.  She is requesting this loan in order to purchase rice, sugar, oil, corn, beans, soda, snacks and other basic products to sell.  Her future plans are to improve her living conditions and her sales by adding new products for sale.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, corn, beans, soda and snacks, basic products to sell

loans.name: Uniendo Fuerzas Group

texts.es: Salome tiene 65 años es viuda hace 14 años  tiene 10 hijos independientes. Ser socia del grupo “UNIENDO FUERZAS” le ha ayudado a iniciar su negocio de mazamorra y tripita de pollo en forma ambulatoriamente. A la vez se dedica al lavado de ropa hace 8 años. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de vasos y cucharitas descartable. Su mayor deseo es construir su casa con cuarto para poder alquilarlo de esa manera podrá obtener un ingreso fijo. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Salome es la primera persona parada en lado izquierdo.
texts.en:
Salome is 65 years old and has been a widow for some 14 years. She has 10 children, all of whom are independent. Being a member of the "Uniting Forces" Group has helped Salome with her business of selling local dishes -- 'maize porridge' and 'repeated again chicken" -- in the streets. At the same time, she has also worked at laundering clothes for some 8 years.

The loan she requests will be invested in purchasing cups and disposable spoons. Salome's greatest desire is to build her house, including a room to be rented out. In this manner, she will be able to obtain a fixed income.

The Group thanks Kiva investors for offering loans to members. In the photo, Salome is the 1st person shown on the left side.

loans.use: buy disposable cups and spoons for her meals business.

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат 46-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее есть сын и дочь. Она со своей семьей проживает в районе Спитамен. Ее муж работает строителем на частных объектах, а сын занимается услугой такси. Саодат имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. Сейчас Саодат намерена начать торговый бизнес. Она приобрела лавку на центральном рынке района и намерена заняться продажей продуктов питания. Чтобы начать бизнес, Саодат запрашивает кредит для закупа товара. Кредит поможет ей иметь собственный бизнес и тем самым улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en:
Saodat is a 46-year-old married woman. She has a son and daughter. She resides with her family in the Spitamen region. Her husband works in construction in private facilities, and her son is engaged in taxi services. Saodat has a small plot of land where she grows agricultural crops. Now Saodat intends to start a trading business. She acquired a shop in the central market area and intends to start selling food products. 

To start a business, Saodat is requesting a loan to purchase goods. The loan will help her to have her own business and thus to improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to buy food products for sale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 45 years old, married and has two children. Agnes lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City.
Agnes has a retail business, engaging in buying and selling to earn a living. She has had this business for almost one year. Each month, she earns PHP 3,000 from this business. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 as capital for her retail business inventory. Agnes has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Agnes hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to provide capital for her retail business inventory.

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
39-year-old Zaur lives in the Batumi district with his wife, two children (7 and 12 years old) and his retired mother. Zaur requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Zaur is working at the local wood workshop as a wood artisan. His wife is working at a restaurant as a cook helper. They both earn small monthly salaries. Additional family income is Zaur’s mother’s monthly pension.

Zaur requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Zaur will purchase equipment for wood processing and open his own wood workshop. As he is already experienced in this field and is well known among the villagers, Zaur will have a good number of clients. As Zaur will not be dependent on a small salary anymore, and will have private orders, his income will significantly increase. He will work hard and log many hours to try and expand his business. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for wood processing and open his own wood workshop.

loans.name: Saif

texts.en:
Saif is an Iraqi youth client. He is 21 years old and lives with his family of 6. Saif, his father, and 2 of his brothers provide the family income.

Saif owns a small shop where he sells raw chicken and various types of birds. He has been in this field since 2009 and has gained good experience. Saif is gradually growing in popularity in the area and is gaining the respect of his neighborhood thanks to his good customer service and his competitive prices.

Saif is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD to renovate his workplace. He believes that this loan will positively impact the improvement of his business and that the increase of profits will give him the ability to achieve his goals--to get married and establish his own family.

loans.use: to renovate his workplace

loans.name: Rasoul

texts.en:
Rasoul, age 26, owns a small shop where he sells stationery items and offers photocopying services. He established his business in 2006 and has gained much experience in this field. Rasoul is the only person with this type of business in the area, and he has attained a strong reputation and a high level of respect in the neighborhood. He and his wife have one child, and he works hard to provide for his family.
   
Rasoul is requesting a youth loan in the amount of 1,800 USD. He will use his loan funds to buy a motor generator and to obtain more stationery items to offer for sale. 

Rasoul is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that one day he may open a bigger shop and provide a greater array of services for his community.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator and stationery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 50 años de edad, está casada con Esteban quien es empleado y padre de sus 2 hijos ,con quienes vive en su casa propia.Rosa se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas como gaseosas y cervezas por está razón tiene una refrigeradora en donde coloca diariamente las bebidas para que alcancen el punto óptimo de enfriamiento para su venta. Complementa sus ingresos económicos con la venta de comida como arroz chaufa, pollo frito, carne asada y demás platos. Realiza esta labor por las noches y todos los fines de semana con el apoyo de sus hijos. Cumple esta actividad cerca de 8 años y le gusta su trabajo pues tiene un ingreso económico con el cual apoya a su esposo con los gastos del hogar ya que muchas veces con el sueldo que el percibe no logra suplir las necesidades económicas que generan los estudios universitarios de sus hijos. Lo considera rentable por la regularidad con la que sus clientes consumen todo lo que ofrece a la venta, es por eso que desea comprar otro congelador y continuar trabajando con mucho optimismo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles para la compra de gaseosas y cervezas además de algunos ingredientes que necesita para la preparación de sus platillos como arroz, condimentos, carnes y verduras.
texts.en:
Rose is 50 years old and is married to her husband, Esteban, who has a job and is a father to their 2 children.  They live together in their own house.  Rosa works selling cold drinks, such as soda and beer.  For this reason, she has a refrigerator where she refrigerates her drinks every day so they reach the optimal temperature to be sold.  She complements what she makes selling drinks by selling food such as chaufa rice, fried chicken, carne asada, and other dishes.  She manages this business in the evenings and also every weekend (with the support of her children).

She has had this business for 8 years and enjoys it because she can make money to support her husband with the household expenses, since his salary often isn't enough to cover the cost of their children's university studies.  She considers her business a success due to the regularity with which her customers buy everything that she offers to sell.  For this reason, she wants to buy another refrigerator and continue working with great enthusiasm.

At this time, she is asking for 1,000 sols (US$375) to buy soda, beer, and various food ingredients such as rice, condiments/seasonings, meat, and vegetables, which she needs to make food dishes.

loans.use: buy carbonated beverages and ingredients such as rice, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es: Federico, de 37 años de edad, esta casado y tiene un hijo de 14 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en compañía de su hermana, su sobrino y su familia en la casa de su madre.Federico se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles tales como embutidos, leche, arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, aceite, condimentos,entre otros. Para cumplir este trabajo estableció una pequeña tienda en la casa de su madre donde atiende las necesidades de sus vecinos quienes son sus principales clientes ya que los atiende muy amablemente. Empezó esta actividad hace 20 años auqnue eventualmente se dedica al transporte público en su mototaxi , considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque le genera muy buenas ganancias. Le gusta su actividad pues le permite estar en contacto con muchas personas. Su principal deseo es seguir trabajando e incrementar la variedad y cantidad de productos que ofrece.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 soles y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará productos comestibles tales como arroz, aceites, bebidas gasificadas y golosinas.
texts.en:
Federico, 37 years old, is married and has a 14 year old son.  He lives with his sister, his nephew and his family in his mother's house.  Federico sells edible products such as sausages, milk, rice, sugar, bread, eggs, oil, and condiments among others.  He opened a small store in his mother's house where he attends to the needs of his neighbors who are his main customers as he treats them well.

He started this business twenty years ago, but he also works as a mototaxi driver.  However, he considers his business to be very profitable as it generates a lot of revenue.  He enjoys his business since it allows him to be in contact with a lot of people.  His main wish is to continue working and to increase the variety and volume of products that he offers.  He is requesting a loan of 1,000 Soles and is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiving to continue with his business.  With the requested amount, he will purchase food products such as rice, oil, sodas and snacks.

loans.use: purchase food products such as rice, oils, soda and snacks.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is a Roma woman, and a married mother of two. Her children are 19 and 17 years old. They reside in a main city, within their community in south-central Albania.

Natasha has been selling used clothes and other items for the past ten years, in her area. She doesn’t own a booth at a Roma market -- neither the one that was built by the municipality, nor the one built by Roma people, themselves. Instead, she sells her items in the city’s streets wherever she can. Natasha says:  “I want to avoid booth rental expenses, and I have been selling in the street or from home for all these years, and haven’t had any problems doing this.”  With the loan of 100,000 Albanian Lek (ALL) that Natasha is applying for, she wants to buy some more seasonal items to resell.

loans.use: to buy summer-season used clothes and other items to resell

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza of Yahong, Tudela, helps her family with their charcoal making and production business. She is 29 years old and married with 2 children. She has managed this business for almost 4 years and earns about 4,500 PHP per month. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase additional coconut shells to produce more charcoal to sell. She plans to use her generated revenue as additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for making charcoal.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
48-year-old Badri lives alone in Martvili district. Badri requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. Badri owns a plot of agricultural land where nut trees are grown. He also has a vineyard and trades with firewood. Harvested products are sold at the local markets and Badri earns a small monthly income.

Badri requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Badri will purchase a milk cow. He will be milking the cow every day to produce cheese. Badri will sell the cheese at the local markets and increase his monthly income. With the increased income he will be able to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
Kazem is a married Iraqi client who is 42 years old, married, and has three children. In order to provide the family living and the school expenses of the three children, Kazem works extra hours in his hardwarel store, where he sells both electrical and structural materials. He established his business in 2006 and has gained good experience in this field. Kazem became well-known in his surroundings thank to his competitive prices.

Kazem is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his store. Kazem believes that this renovation will result in the improvement of his business and in the increase of his profits and will give him the ability to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his store

loans.name: 04-11-04-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đức operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks for resale. 

Đức is 38 years old and she is married with two children. Đức is the group leader of the 04-11-04-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2012, Đức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Đức has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Đức has been involved in this business for eight years. The main hardship that Đức faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Using her business profit, Đức hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase liquor, beer, and snacks for resale.

loans.name: 08-Ts3-04-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Nguyệt, age 59, operates a food stall business, selling vegetables. She has operated her business for two years. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Nguyệt reports that the primary obstacle she faces in her business is lack of capital.

She and her husband have three children, two of whom are grown and one of whom is still a dependent. 

Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in 2012 with the goal of improving her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the 08-TS3-04-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

Nguyệt is requesting a loan in order to purchase vegetables to offer for sale. She would like to see her business flourish so that she can apply her profit toward ensuring the health and happiness of her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house for the family to live in.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Beverline C.

texts.en:
Beverline, age 38, owns and operates a shop where she sells artificial hair. She started her business with money given to her by her husband and has run her venture for the past three years. On average, she works nine hours per day. Beverline transports her merchandise by taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the flow of customers.
 
Beverline lives with her husband and their three children in St. Paul, a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Freeport. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for its fish, due to its location by the sea. It is one of the poorer areas of the country and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Beverline's husband sells gasoline to earn an income. Their children are between the ages of five and 18 years old. All three are enrolled in school and living at home. Beverline herself completed 12 grades of school.
 
She will use her loan funds to purchase inventory for her shop. In the future, she would like to build a house for the family to live in.
   
She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Aminata, in her late 40s, from Tombo, in western rural Sierra Leone. She is widowed, with four children between the ages of seven and 25 years. Two of her children are attending school. 

Aminata runs a fish business within her community. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business eight hours per day and seven days per week. Her major challenge is insufficient capital to run her business. 

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more fish for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living by meeting their daily needs and paying her children's school fees. In the future, she plans to become a wholesaler in the fish business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Gbassary

texts.en:
Gbassary prepares and sells fish to earn an income. She offers her wares at a busy market, working 10 hours per day, six days per week. She has been running this business since 2006. She cites her primary challenge as the inconsistent availability of fish from the wharf. 

She is in her early forties and lives in the Tombo Western rural area of Freetown. Her husband is a fisherman and they are blessed with four children between the ages of four and 20 years old. Two of the children are still attending school. 
 
Gbassary has requested a loan in order to purchase more fish to prepare and offer for sale. The extra income generated from this loan will allow her to ensure the education of her children and to make essential renovations to her house. Her goal for the future is to build a new house for the family to live in. 
 
She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fish to prepare and offer for sale

loans.name: Valentyna Vanessa

texts.es: Valentyna de 21 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 1 año de que la inspira a seguir trabajando fuertemente para lograr que tenga bienestar.  Ella de padres comerciantes, aprendió desde muy niña a ser independiente y por eso siguió este ejemplo, vendiendo ropa para damas, caballeros y niños. Inició hace 5 años, vendiendo en las poblaciones de Piojó Pivijay y Manatí, ropa para damas caballeros e infantil y desde entonces no se ha detenido. Hoy vende a crédito desde los lunes hasta los domingos y compra en un municipio cercano, donde consigue buenos precios. Su meta es incrementar sus inventarios, para tener un mejor surtido. Porque en el futuro, sueña con tener una vivienda propia y lograr que su hijo  tenga estudios profesionales de calidad, y alcance  sus metas de éxito. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará vestidos para damas, caballeros e infantil, con el propósito de dar respuesta a su demanda y con ello empezar a cumplir su sueño de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Velentyna is 21 years old and has a 1-year-old son, who is her inspiration to keep working hard, because she wants him to be well taken care of.  Her parents are also entrepreneurs and she learned to be independent when she was very young.  For this reason, she followed their example and sells women's, men's, and children's clothing.  She started selling these clothes 5 years ago and hasn't stopped since then, selling in the Piojó, Pivijay, and Manatí communities.

She now sells on credit every day of the week and buys her clothes at a nearby city, where she gets good prices.  Her goal is to increase her inventory so as to be better stocked.  In the future, she dreams of having her own house and being able to send her son to get a good-quality, professional education and thereby reach his goals of success.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan and this is her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  With this loan, she will buy women's, men's, and children's clothing with the aim of meeting demand.  By so doing, she can start to fulfill her dream of obtaining prosperity.

loans.use: buy women's, men's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Stiven

texts.es: Stiven de 26 años de edad, tiene un negocio familiar, a través del cual ofrece el servicio de servicios publicitarios y de fotografía en general, desde hace 5 años. Este negocio se ha mantenido a través de los años,  pues su padre enseño a Stiven como lograrlo y esto lo agradece mucho. En su negocio ofrece filmaciones y fotografías, en un pequeño estudio y también servicio domicilio, de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana  hasta las 8 de la noche. Su meta es mejorar la calidad de su negocio y a futuro ampliar y abrir sucursales. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará un equipo fotográfico de mayor tecnología y una impresora, para hacer de su credikiva una inversión exitosa, con el aumento de su clientela, que accederá prontamente a la calidad con la cual trabajará con la nueva herramienta..
texts.en:
Stiven, 26 years old, has a family business in which he has offered advertising and general photography services over the past five years.  This business has been maintained over the years since Stiven's father taught him how to accomplish it, for which he is very grateful.  His business offers films and photographs in a small studio as well as in-home service Monday-Saturday from 8am to 8pm.  

His goal is to improve the quality of his business and in the future expand and open subsidiaries.  Presently, he is applying for a Kiva loan which will allow up to purchase high-tech photography equipment and a printer.  The investment made with his Kiva loan will be successful because his clientele will grow as they will have access to his new high quality equipment.

loans.use: purchase high-tech photography equipment and a printer.

loans.name: Yesenia Ivette

texts.es:
Yesenia tiene 29 años de edad, desde muy pequeña ha pasado por momentos difíciles pero ello no disminuyo su alegría y sus ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de que sus padres tenían pocos recursos económicos Yesenia con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logro estudiar la carrera Educación.  Por ello cada día Yesenia se levanta muy temprano ya que dicta clases en una escuela de educación primaria, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; ella cree que está saliendo adelante porque le gusta mucho su profesión y sobre todo que desea aportar con su enseñanza al futuro de los niños.

Yesenia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar carpetas, pizarra, sillas, útiles escolares, entre otros ya que Yesenia dicta clases particulares en su vivienda y actualmente no tiene los implementos necesarios para darle comodidad a los niños en las clases, así de esta manera sus alumnos estudiaran en mejores condiciones y ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos, así ella seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Sacar su título profesional y poder apoyar a su familia”.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 29 years old. From the time she was very young she has gone through difficult times, but that did not diminish her happiness and desire to move ahead, despite the fact that her parents had very few economic resources. With a lot of effort and dedication, Yesenia succeeded in studying Education. Because of this, every day Yesenia gets up very early, since she teaches classes at a primary school. She works around 9 hours per day, and with the fruit of her labor she supports her parents with the household expenses. She believes that she is moving ahead because she likes her profession a lot, and above all she wants to contribute to the children's future through her teaching.

Yesenia is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy desks, a blackboard, chairs, and school supplies, among other items. Yesenia gives private classes in her home and currently she does not have the necessary supplies to make the children comfortable in class. This way, her students will study in better conditions and she will be able to improve her income, and she will continue fighting in order to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: to receive her professional license and be able to support her family.

loans.use: to buy desks, chairs, and blackboards, among other items

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is from the village of Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 62 years old. Felomina is married and has three children. To make a living, she owns a farm, planting and harvesting corn to sell. She has been in this business for 17 years and earns about PHP 4,000 a month from these activities. 

Aside from farming, she also manages her own sari sari store, running it for many years. In order to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products for sale, she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and bottled products to sell.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is an Egyptian who lives in southeastern Albania. She divorced her husband almost six years ago after he emigrated to Greece and left her to raise their 2-year-old child who now attends the public school.

”It’s been very difficult for me financially since then, but I try hard to secure food and necessary school items for my child. I have been very fortunate to be able to get loans from VisionFund Albania. This would be my fifth loan from this institution and I am very thankful to them for all their help.  I buy used clothes and resell them. I don’t have a particular booth or place here in the city to sell; I sell in the villages and this makes it easier for me because there is almost no competition,” she said. 

Ardiana wants to buy some used items with the loan she is applying for and resell them. She is requesting 60,000 Albanian Lek for this.

loans.use: To buy used items to resell.

loans.name: Luz Yesenia

texts.es:
Luz es una joven de 21 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Pisco y cada día se levanta muy temprano para ir a su centro d elabores, ya que ella trabaja como empleada en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad. Asimismo tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de bocaditos con lo cual tiene un ingreso extra; Luz cree que está saliendo adelante porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es muy colaboradora.

Luz está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo ella podrá comprar insumos y materiales para la elaboración de bocaditos como harina al por mayor, azucar en sacos, glucosa, entre otros y de esta manera tener más ingresos ya que tiene muchos pedidos, así ella mejorara su calidad de vida y seguirá luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su panadería”.
texts.en:
Luz is a 21-year-old young woman who lives in the city of Pisco. Every day she gets up very early to go to work, since she is an employee at a small business in her city. She also has a small business selling snacks, which gives her extra income. Luz believes she is moving ahead because she is very responsible and above all because she is very helpful.

Luz is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the great help she will be able to buy supplies and materials for making snacks such as wholesale flour, sacks of sugar, and glucose, among others. In this way, she will have more income, since she has a lot of orders, and will improve her quality of life and continue to fight in order to be able to make her biggest dream a reality: to have her own bakery.

loans.use: to purchase supplies (flour and sugar, among others)

loans.name: Coran

texts.en: Coran is 31 years old and lives in St. Paul, Liberia, which is home to the oldest market in the country and known for its fish because of its location by the sea. It is just outside of Monrovia, beyond Freeport.  It is one of the poorer areas of the country, and its residents often live in sub-standard housing. Coran completed 12 grades of schooling, is married and has two children who are 18 and 5 years old. For the last three years, she has owned a shop where she sells fresh milk, mayonnaise, butter and other items.  She will use this loan to buy more items to sell. On average, she works for 13 hours a day and started her business with money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by bus and says that her biggest challenge is her country's rainy season. Her favorite part of her business is talking to and helping customers.  In the future, she would like to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris, de 45 años de edad, está casada con William quien es policía y padre de su hijo José de 16 años de edad, juntos viven en su casa propia.Doris se dedica a la confección. Aprendió este oficio hace 10 años ayudando a una amiga en su taller de confecciones, con las ganancias que logró obtener pudo comprar su propia máquina de coser , desde entonces tiene 10 años realizando este trabajo, tiempo en el cual ha logrado hacerse conocida e implementar poco a poco su local. Actualmente ella misma crea, diseña y refacciona todo tipo de ropa. Cuenta con la ayuda de 2 señoras más quienes la apoyan para cumplir con todos los pedidos que le asignan sus clientes.Le gusta su actividad porque le permite tener un ingreso económico con el cual solventa los gastos de su hogar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, está agradecida y contenta por el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.Con el monto solicitado comprará materiales de confección como telas, botones, agujas, blondas, elásticos e hilos en mayor cantidad para que siga cumpliendo su labor.
texts.en:
Doris is 45 years old. She is married to William, who is a policeman. Together they have one son, Jose, who is 16 years old. They all live in a house they own. Doris works as a seamstress. She learned the trade 10 years ago, helping a friend at her tailoring workshop. With her earnings, she bought her own sewing machine and has been working as a seamstress for 10 years. She has become well known and has installed her own workshop.
Now she designs, creates and manufactures all types of clothes. She has the assistance of two women who help her fulfill her customers' orders. She enjoys her job because it allows her to have some extra income which pays for the household expenses.
She is asking for 2500 nuevos soles and she is happy and grateful for the financial support she needs to push her business project forward. With the loan money, Doris will buy tailoring materials such as fabric, buttons, needles, blond lace, elastic bands and thread so she can keep doing her work.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabric, thread, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Viviam Gissell

texts.es:
Doña Vivían es madre de dos pequeños niños de once y cinco años ambos están en la escuela viven en  la ciudad de Estelí. Se dedica al negocio de transporte escolar atiende dos escuelas por el momento haciendo varios recorridos al día ha sido un trabajo duro y de mucho sacrificio entre ella y su esposo atienden el negocio empezaron con un microbús que pudieron comprar con ahorros de varios años luego con un financiamiento compraron otro microbús al día de hoy tiene dos buses pequeños sirviendo en el  negocio de transporte  escolar ella siente que tiene un gran mercado donde ofrecer sus servicios. 
 	
 	Ella tiene como metas futuras  comprar otro microbús por que la demanda es grande y sus metas próximas son crecer como empresaria ý que su negocio de transporte siga adelante solicito este crédito para pagar el overhaul de uno de los microbúses y un  cambio de repuesto.  
 	Este crédito le ayudara mucho porque brindara un mejor servicio con mayor seguridad ya que tendrá los dos microbuses trabajando en buenas condiciones sus expectativas son tener su flota de transporte y ser una empresaria reconocida.
texts.en:
Vivían is a mother of two small children (ages 11 and 5) who are both in school.  They live in the city of Estelí.  She works transporting children to school and at the moment serves two schools, making several routes per day.  It has been a hard job and has required a lot of sacrifice.  She and her husband contribute to the job.  They started with one minibus that they bought with their savings.  Later, they were able to buy another minibus by taking out a loan.  They now have two small buses for their school transportation business.  She feels like there is a large market where she can offer her services.

Her future goals are to buy another minibus, since demand is great.  In addition, she soon hopes to grow as a business, since it is progressing.  She is asking for this loan to buy spare parts and pay for repairs for one of the minibuses.

This loan will help her a lot, since it will improve her service and make her business more secure, since she will have two minibuses in good condition.  Her hopes are to have a true fleet of transit vehicles and become a well-known entrepreneur.

loans.use: buy spare parts and pay for minibus repairs.

loans.name: Zulkhumor

texts.ru: Зулхумор жительница Гиссарского района. Ей 46 лет. Она замужем и является матерью двоих детей. Зулхумор работает учительницей в средней школе. Так как ее заработная плата очень маленькая и не хватает на семейные расходы, Зулхумор решила открыть собственный бизнес. Она хочет открыть в своем районе дилерский центр и предоставлять такие услуги как: продажа телефонных симкарт, пополнение счета телефона, а также копировальные услуги. Зулхумор уже приобрела помещение для совего бизнеса. Она запрашивает кредит, чтобы приобрести копировальную машину и телефонные симкарты. Этот кредит поможет ей открыть собственный бизнес и улучшить условия проживания.
texts.en:
Zulkhumor is an inhabitant of the Gissar region. She is 46 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children. 

Zulkhumor works as a high school teacher. Since her salary is very small and not enough for the family expenses, Zulkhumor decided to open her own business. She wants to open a business center in their neighborhood and to provide services such as selling telephone Sim cards, refilling mobile phone accounts, and fax services. Zulkhumor already acquired a room for her business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to purchase a copy machine and Sim cards. This loan will help her to open her own business and to improve living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a copy machine and telephone Sim cards to open a business center

loans.name: 04-10-10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mai is applying for a loan to buy dry food such as candy, milk, sugar and noodles to resell. She has a retail business selling dry food. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

Mai is 58 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 04-10-10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents; her children are grown up.

In 2012, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. 

The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her business profits, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to buy dry food such as candy, milk, sugar, and noodles to resell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is 36 years old, married and the father of 2 children. Ahmad lives with his brothers and parents. He owns a small shop and specializes in selling various types of textiles for various uses. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. 

He is requesting a loan of 1,700 USD. He will use this loan to pay the annual rent on his shop. Ahmad believes that this loan will change his current financial conditions and will give him the ability to provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent on his shop.

loans.name: Knarik

texts.en:
Knarik is 52 years old. She lives with her son and mother-in-law in Zovaber village which is in Sevan area. Her daughter is married and lives with her family separately from Knarik. She has had a hard life and she had to work day and night in order to sustain her children. 

 For a long time Knarik used to work as a weaver in Sevan, but after Soviet Union's collapse she became jobless. Since 1990 Knarik is engaged in agricultural business. With her children she has built a large barn for animals and breeds cows and raises more than 15 sheep. Knarik also has plot of land near her house and grows potatoes and cucumber. The agricultural products; vegetables, meat, and dairy products are sold in Sevan food markets and she receives a good profit. 

Nowadays Knarik is very happy and as she confessed, she is appreciated for her agricultural business and she is glad that she is able to meet her family's needs and help her children.

Knarik decided to enlarge her animal breeding business and to add to the number of her animals. She asks for a loan from Kiva to buy three calves and fodder for her animals. This is the first loan with Kiva for Knarik and she hopes to deserve Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy three calves and fodder for her animals

loans.name: 08-Ts3-03-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
