The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Soledad.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation by a family member who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business making and selling flannel clothes.  She learned this business from her sister who is in the same line of work.  With help from her mother she set up her own sales space four years ago.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric and a sewing machine in street markets in El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate income to support her family in any way possible since she’s single but still living with her mother.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the training and the group meetings.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel tiene 20 años de edad, es un joven soltero cuyo negocio consiste en la venta de perfumes por encargo, vive con sus padres en el municipio de Arjona en el departamento de Bolívar, ubicado muy cerca a la capital Cartagena de Indias. Este municipio es reconocido por una de sus actividades económicas   producción y venta de subproductos como lo son el bollo, elaborado a base de maíz viche o seco, y de subproductos lácteos como lo son el queso y el suero, comercializados en tiendas de la población y en las calles y plazas de la ciudad de Cartagena. Este oficio es realizado por familias enteras y ha sido un legado que se ha mantenido de generación en generación y que le ha dado al municipio un titulo que muy pocos conocen, como es el de la capital mundial del bollo. En este ambiente de comercialización  poblacional, Luis comenzó su negocio hace año y medio con la ayuda de sus padres; hoy cuenta con una clientela fija, que le hace los pedidos periódicamente, y le pagan los productos en cuotas quincenales. Uno de los objetivos de tomar los créditos es la de aumentar su capital de trabajo en su negocio, para que crezca, y pueda mejorar en sus ingresos, para aportar al pago de los gastos de la casa; y en cuanto a su vida personal, convertirse en un profesional en mercadeo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumes que le han solicitado sus clientes y el hacerlo sobre pedidos, hace que esta inversión tenga un potencial de éxito..
texts.en:
Luis Manuel is 20 years old. He is single. His business consists in the sale of perfumes previously ordered by his customers. He lives with his parents in the municipality of Arjona, in the province of Bolivar, very close to the capital, Cartagena de Indias. Arjona is known for the manufacture and sale of products such as spongy bread rolls made from unripe or dry corn and dairy products such as cheese and whey. These products are sold in stores in the city and also in the streets and squares of Cartagena. Whole families participate in this trade and this legacy has been passed on from generation to generation. This has given the city a less known title, that of world capital of spongy bread rolls.
Luis started his business in this environment a year and a half ago with the help of his parents. He has a loyal clientele that makes orders periodically and pays in biweekly installments. One of the purposes of the loan is to increase the working capital of the business, so it can grow and Luis can improve his profit. He wants to contribute to the household expenses and, on a personal level, become a marketing professional.
He is applying for a loan from Kiva through the field partner, Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase perfumes previously ordered by his clients. Since he buys upon request, this investment has the potential to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes

loans.name: Esmeralda 2 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA 2”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Isabel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de accesorios de celular, venta de repuestos, venta de verduras, tienda de barrio, venta de calzados, venta de carne de cordero, venta de estuco, venta de faldas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Isabel es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de sus vecinas que son parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió porque deseaba un negocio en su hogar, para cuidar a sus hijos; en la actualidad le va muy bien.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de aceites, azúcar, etc.) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros.

En la imagen no se encuentra una socia, ya que se fue a realizar consulta médica.
texts.en:
The ‘Esmeralda 2” (Emerald 2) communal bank will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Villa Adela Focal Center.  It has nine members led by a governing board presided over by Isabel.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are mobile phone accessories sales, spare parts sales, vegetable sales, neighborhood store, shoe sales, lamb meat sales, stucco sales and skirt sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Isabel.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for 8 months having joined thanks to an invitation by her neighbors who are part of the institution.  She currently has a neighborhood store.  She relates that she started the business because she wanted a home-based business so she could care for her children.  She’s currently doing very well.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy oil, sugar, etc. from wholesalers and then sell it in her sales space.  This way of working makes it possible for her to generate resources to support her home however possible since she’s single and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answer that she likes the savings.

One of the members does not appear in the photo because she was keeping a medical appointment.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store..

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque estos son un buen recurso económico para trabajar y obtener ingresos económicos; este le permitirá comprar cerdos medianos para crecerlos y engordarlos para después comercializarlos, concentrado y asimismo para adquirir aves de corral tales como: gallinas y pollos.
El crédito anterior le ha ayudado  a obtener muchas ganancias y con ello ha continuado invirtiendo en el negocio y ha logrado abastecer los gastos del hogar; las condiciones económicas han mejorado, ya que los ingresos han aumentado y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
Maria wants to opt for a new loan because it is a good economic resource for work and to earn income. 

This will allow her to buy medium sized hogs to grow and fatten up to then sell the meat.  She  will also buy poultry such as hens and chickens. 

The previous loan has helped her profits and with this she has kept investing in the business and has been able to maintain the household expenses. 

Her economic situation has improved since income has increased and the family circumstances have improved as well.

loans.use: to buy medium sized hogs to grow and fatten up to then sell the meat; as well as hens and chickens.

loans.name: Leny

texts.es: Leny tiene 45 años de edad es una mujer soltera, vive en la casa de su papa acompañada de su hija y sus 2 nietos.Leny se dedica a la venta de ceviche en la puerta de su casa, tiene muy buena acogida por eso ha implementado su negocio. Al principio por falta de capital no podía ampliarlo para que dinamice sus ventas, pero gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su padre pudo salir adelante y ahora tiene un negocio estable que le genera ingresos para su hogar.Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento que le permite crecer con su negocio.En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de los insumos para la preparación de ceviche tales como limones , pescado , condimentos , entre otros.
texts.en: Leny is 45 years old and single woman.  She lives at home with her father along with her daughter and two grandchildren.  She works selling ceviche from the door of her home. She is well situated and for that reason she began her business.  At the beginning, due to lack of capital, she could not expand it in order to increase sales, but thanks to God and the support of her father she was able to get ahead and now she has a stable business that generates income for her home.  This is her first credit with Kiva, and she is very thankful for the opportunity that has been offered to obtain a line of credit that will permit her to grow her business.  At this time she is asking for 1500 soles (Peruvian currency) which she will invest in the purchase of foods for the preparation of ceviche such as limes, fish, condiments and other items.

loans.use: to purchase items for making ceviche such as limes, fish, condiments and other items

loans.name: Sia

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 25-year-old Sia from Tombo, a western rural area of Freetown. She is married with two children, ages 1 and 6 years old. Her children attend school. 

Sia runs a plastic slippers sales business; she sells different types of slippers. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that despite business hardships, she is very hardworking and wants to become successful.

Sia has requested a loan in order to buy variety of plastic slippers for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her installments. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy variety of plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Hasanin

texts.en:
Hasanin is a 27-year-old married man. He is the father of one son and one daughter. Hasanin is an employee with a very low wage, which is the only source of income for the family. 

Hasanin took a 1,273 USD Mruabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy some home appliances, specifically a washing machine and refrigerator. This will help Hasanin to improve the home's condition.
 
Hasanin appears in the Kiva profile picture.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and refrigerator for his home.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina a sus 30 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en casa de sus suegros, acompañada de su esposo y sus tres hijos.Karina se dedica al comercio, actualmente tiene un negocio donde vende bebidas gasificas, hielos y postres siendo su hogar su propio centro de trabajo aunque a veces sale a vender de manera ambulatoria. Como una mujer emprendedora siempre busca maneras de percibir ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia. Al principio se les hizo muy difícil ya que no contaban con liquidez económica para la compra de sus productos, y no tenia un lugar indicado para el negocio pero gracias al apoyo de su familia pudo abrir su negocio sin problemas.Como una mujer trabajadora y responsable, espera sacar adelante su pequeño negocio y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes ofreciéndoles un mejor producto y de calidad. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral.
En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.1500 soles para la compra de bebidas gasificadas e insumos para la preparación de los postres.
texts.en:
Karina, 30, is a very hardworking woman.  She lives in her parents-in-law’s house with her husband and three children.  Karina’s a merchant.  She currently has a business where she sells carbonated beverages, ice and desserts.  She works from home although sometimes she does go out to sell from place to place.  Like any enterprising woman she’s always looking for ways to earn income to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

At first, it was very difficult for them because they did not have economic liquidity to buy their products and she did not have a place set aside for the business.  However, thanks to her family’s support she was able to open the business with no problem.  Since she’s a hardworking, responsible woman, she hopes to move her small business forward and to make it grow such that she can supply her customers offering them better quality products.

This is her first Kiva loan and she’s very grateful for the opportunity that presents itself to attain a line of credit that will be very useful for her work’s development.  On this occasion she’ll ask for 1,500 soles to buy carbonated soft-drinks and ingredients to make the desserts.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks and ingredients to make desserts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Transito Edenilson

texts.es:
Transito, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado; este le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a tener los insumos agrícolas necesarios en el momento oportuno para la siembra; las condiciones económicas han mejorado y asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Transito would like to opt for a new loan due to the need for more work capital to keep investing in growing corn and raising cattle. 

This will let him buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides etc. 

The previous loan helped him with the agricultural supplies needed at the opportune moment for planting. 

His economic situation has improved as well as his family circumstances.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides etc.

loans.name: Jenny Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Jenny ha sido una de las mejores clientas gracias a los financiamientos su negocio de pulpería ha crecido, tiene más surtido su negocio, ha hecho nuevos clientes se siente muy agradecida por brindarle la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio. 
Hoy requiere este crédito para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en: Jenny’s been one of the best clients.  Thanks to the loans her grocery store has grown.  Her store is better stocked and she’s gained new customers.  She feels very grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business that she was given.  Today, she needs this loan to buy rice, sugar, beans, oil and soft-drinks at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es:
María, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para seguir invirtiendo y surtir la tienda; este le permitirá comprar productos de la canasta básica, tales como: arroz, frijol, maíz, cereales, azúcar, sal, aceite, jabón, entre otros productos perecederos. 
El efecto del crédito anterior fue de mucha utilidad, ya que le genero muchas oportunidades para continuar luchando en su negocio, satisfacción de los clientes por la variedad de mercadería que brinda; gracias al crédito otorgado le ha creado abundantes ganancias económicas, en los cuales las invirtió en los gastos de graduación de sus dos hijos, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María needs to choose another loan because she needs more working capital to continue investing in and stocking her store.  This will make it possible for her to buy basic family staple items like rice, beans, corn, cereals, sugar, salt, oil and soap, among other perishables.

Her previous loan was very useful in that it generated many opportunities to continue striving in her business and customer satisfaction because of the variety of merchandise on hand.  Thanks to the granted loan she’s earned abundant profits that she used to pay for her two children’s graduation expenses.  Her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Barahunda Group

texts.es:
Barahunda es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 11 personas emprendedoras, cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad económica con la intención de forjar una mejor vida para sus familias, ellos decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que es el nombre de la comunidad donde viven ellos y el significado de la palabra Barahunda es alegría y fiesta ellos se identifican con este.

Doña Martha es uno de los integrantes de dicho grupo,ella platica que desde muy pequeña le ha gustado trabajar y que desde hace mas de nueve años junto a su esposo ha establecido una pequeña carnicería en la casa de su suegra ya que esta  se ubica a orilla de la carretera y ayuda a que se venda mas, ella realiza sus ventas dos veces por semana los jueves y domingos y un día antes sale a ofrecer su carne con sus amigos y vecinos y el día que alinea el cerdo sale en su moto hacer los entregos y lo que le sobra lo  vende en su carnicería, ella ademas prepara longaniza, chicharrones y carnitas. 

Un crédito de Vision Fund le ayudara a invertirlo en la compra de cerdos para continuar con sus ventas. Ha futuro le gustaría iniciar a criar cerdos para ya no tener que comprarlos.

Ella esta muy contenta con su actividad porque durante estos años le ha dado empleo y ha podido dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Los demás Integrantes del grupo son:

Maria de Lourdes venta de perfumes
Elia muebleria
Alicia venta de productos naturistas
Maricela venta de ropa
Victor Luis venta de pescado
Irais Elvira cria de cerdos
Elizabeth cria de cerdos
Perla renta de departamentos
Andrea Elizabeth servicio de decoraciones 
Santa venta de refrescos
texts.en:
“Barahunda” is the name of this group of 11 enterprising people.  Each of them has an economic activity aimed at forging a better life for their families.  They decided to name their group thus because it’s the name of the community where they live and the meaning of the word Barahunda is joy and festivity and they identify with it.

Martha is one of the members of said group.  She relates that since she was very little she’s enjoyed working and for the last nine years she and her husband have been operating a small butcher shop in her mother-in-law’s house since it’s located alongside the highway and that helps to sell more.  She sells twice a week on Thursdays and Sundays and one day before she goes out to sell her meat among her friends and neighbors.  The day she butchers the pig she heads out on her motorcycle to make deliveries and whatever is left over she sells in her butcher shop.  She also makes sausage, fried pork rinds and fried pork.

A VisionFund loan will help her to invest in the purchase of pigs to continue with her sales.  In future she’d like to start raising pigs in order not to have to buy them anymore.  She is very happy with her activity because throughout these years it’s provided her with employment and she’s been able to give her family better quality of life.

The other group members are:

María de Lourdes - perfume sales
Elia - furniture store
Alicia - natural products sales
Maricela - clothing sales
Víctor Luis - fish sales
Irais Elvira - raising pigs
Elizabeth - raising pigs
Perla - apartment rentals
Andrea Elizabeth - decoration services 
Santa - refreshments sales

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rivera Del Rio Group

texts.es:
Rivera del Rio es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 7 personas, cada una de ellas tiene actividades Económicas. Este grupo está ubicado en San Miguel Soyaltepec y decidieron dar este nombre a su grupo ya que así se llama la calle donde realizan sus reuniones y a solo, unos metros pasa el rio de la presa Cerro de Oro.
Don Quirino es uno de los integrantes de este grupo es casado y tiene tres hijos, todos estudian pero uno de ellos ya está en la Universidad. El platica que solo estudio la primaria porque era muy difícil y costoso el estudio. Así que se acercó a un conocido que tenia quien era carpintero, le pidió empleo y aprendió muy rápidamente este oficio, cuando fue mayor decidió poner su propia Carpintería. El ya tiene 20 años realizando esta actividad y al pasar el tiempo ha ganado popularidad por sus buenos trabajos, también plática que gracias a su taller de carpintería a sacado adelante a su familia y a abierto otros pequeños negocios como un auto lavado y compro un sonido para dar ambiente en las fiestas.
El está muy contento y dice que sus negocios son familiares ya que por las tardes enseña a sus hijos a trabajarlos.
El ha solicitado este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de madera, resistol, clavos y dar mantenimiento a sus maquinas.
Don Quirino espera que este negocio continúe prosperando y así poder brindar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rivera del Rio is the name of a communal bank formed by 7 members, with different economic activities. The group is located in San Miguel Soyaltepec. They chose this name because it is the name of the street where they have their meetings. It is located a few meters from the river from the reservoir Cerro de Oro.
Quirino is one of the members of the communal bank. He is married and has three children. They are all studying, but one of them is already in college. Quirino only has primary studies because studying was difficult and expensive, so he approached an acquaintance who was a carpenter and asked for a job. He learned the trade quickly and when he grew up decided to open his own furniture workshop. He has been doing this for 20 years and over the years he has earned a reputation for doing a good job. Quirino also says that thanks to his workshop he has provided for his family and has opened other smaller businesses such as a car wash business. He also bought a sound system to provide music for parties.
Quirino is very happy and he says his businesses are also family businesses because in the afternoons he teaches his children the trade.
He is asking for a loan to purchase wood, glue, nails, etc., and also for maintenance for his equipment.
Quirino hopes his business will continue to prosper so he can offer his children the opportunity to study for a professional degree.

loans.use: to purchase wood, glue, nails and to provide maintenance for his equipment.

loans.name: Carlos Gilbel

texts.es:
Carlos, se le presenta la necesidad de mas capital de trabajo para continuar en el cultivo de granos básicos tales como: frijol y maíz; este le permitirá comprar los insumos agropecuarios precisos, entre estos: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los materiales agrícolas para la siembra, aumentaron los ingresos y ello las utilizo para aportar a su familia; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Carlos needs more working capital to continue cultivating basic staples such as beans and corn. This loan will allow him to buy the farming tools that he needs, including: fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and fungicides.
His previous loan helped him to acquire agricultural supplies for the sowing season. His income increased and he used it to support his family. Their economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, and fungicides..

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Luceros Del Alba Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCEROS DEL ALBA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por siete  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Blanca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: colchones de lana, venta de calzados, venta de frutas, productos ESIKA, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Blanca es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de polleras; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su tía hace quince años, posteriormente decide implementar su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada está esperando un bebe.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, le crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Bright Stars of Alba” communal bank has begun its 3rd loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the “Los Andes” Central Office. It is composed of 7 members and led by a directorate with Blanca as president. The members' businesses are varied; among them, selling woolen mattresses, footwear, fruit, ESIKA products, and meals.

The loan each member will receive will benefit small micro-entreprenuers like member Blanca. She tells us that some 5 years ago she joined Pro Mujer, enrolling at the invitation of a promoter from the institution who visited her home. Now, Blanca has a business making and selling skirts. She says that she learned her business from an aunt some 15 years ago and, subsequently, she decided to implement her own business.
 
The loan Blanca is taking out is to increase her capital for purchasing cloth, which she will acquire from wholesale distributors, then turn into skirts to sell in her market stall. This type of work permits her to generate resources for maintaining her home as much as possible, since she is married and expecting a baby.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Blanca responded that she likes the savings, the loans, the training, and the health area.

loans.use: purchase cloth to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more white and red fish, snapper, shrimps, etc.

loans.name: Lleny

texts.es: Lleny tiene 29 años de edad es una  mujer casada y tiene un hijo , vive junto a su familia en su casa propia.Su principal actividad económica era la docencia, pero hace 4 años que decidió poner un negocio dedicado a la venta de cosméticos, está fue idea de su esposo buscando obtener ingresos extras para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Con los ahorros que tenia de su trabajo como docente y los ahorros de su esposo compraron poco a poco algunos productos para implementar su puesto y gracias a sus ganancias ahora tiene un stock de productos variados en su vitrina. Con los ingresos que tiene espera implementar su negocio para así ofrecer más productos.Para Lleny este es su primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de S/.800.00 soles comprará cosméticos tales como cremas, perfumes, delineadores y otros para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Lleny, 29, is a married woman and has one son. She lives with her family in their own home. 

Her main economic activity is as a teacher, however four years ago she decided to start a business selling cosmetics. 

This was her husband's idea who was looking for extra income in order to improve the quality of life for the family. 

With the savings from her teaching job and the savings from her husband they little by little bought some products and now thanks to the profits have a stock of several products and a  glass case. 

With the income she hopes to improve her business in order to offer more products. 

This is Lleny's first loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the economic support given. She is dedicated to paying her installments on time. 

The 800 PEN [$300] loan will buy cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, eyeliners etc.

loans.use: buy cosmetics such as creams, perfumes, eyeliners etc.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Gladys en su negocio de artesanias, porque con su credikiva compró mas materiales, aumentó su producción y tambien decidió cambiar de local. Ella dice a sus finaciadores que está muy agradecida porque su credikiva anterior le llegó en el momento mas oportuno. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo finacaimiento y esta vez comprará insumos de modistería y acabados para lencería, con ello su oferta de nuevos productos, resplandecerá para su clientela que está muy segura aumentarán. .
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Gladys in her crafting business. With her previous loan on Kiva, she purchased more materials, increased her production, and decided to change her location. She would like to tell her investors that she is very grateful because her loan arrived at the most opportune time. She is currently applying for a new loan. This time, she will buy sewing materials and finishing materials for linens. With this investment, she will offer new products and will really stand out to her clientele--she is sure her customer base will grow.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials and finishing items for linens.

loans.name: Faisurys

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Faysuris, quien con su credikiva pudo comprar mesas, sillas, verduras, arroces, aceite, granos y toda clase de insumos para la elaboración de los alimentos del restaurante. Con esta inversión se mejoró en el capital de trabajo, en la presentación del local y en el servicio a los clientes. En cuanto a lo personal ha podido generar más ingresos para su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo crédito para invertir en la compra de un congelador y en más insumos para prestar un mejor servicio y seguir teniendo éxito en el negocio. Faysuris dice a sus financiadores: “Gracias por su colaboración y que siempre me sigan ayudando”.
texts.en:
Faysuris is grateful for the support from the previous loan, with which she bought tables, chairs, vegetables, rice, oil, grain and an assortment of supplies to prepare the food in her restaurant. Thanks to this investment, the working capital grew, and the appearance of the premises improved, as did the service offered to the customers. On a personal level, she has generated more income for her family.
She is asking for a new loan to purchase a freezer and more supplies in order to offer a better service and keep her business successful.
Faysuris thanks her lenders for their support and hopes they will keep helping her.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and more supplies to prepare her food.

loans.name: Cristian Camilo

texts.es:
Cristian tiene 25 años de edad, y desde niño ha vivido en el campo. Aprendió de las labores agrícolas y pecuarias gracias a su padre quien se dedicó a al desarrollo de estas actividades como actividad económica. En la actualidad se encuentra realizando un curso de porcicultura, razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para iniciar su negocio dedicado a la cría y venta de cerdos,  con el fin de aplicar sus conocimientos y generar ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar.
Sueña con tener una gran marranera y convertirse en el mayor expendedor de carne en su localidad. Con el dinero solicitado desea comprar 2 cerdas preñadas y adecuaciones a corrales.
texts.en:
Cristian is 25. He has lived in the country since he was a child, and learned agriculture from his father, who worked with livestock and crops for a living. Cristian is doing a course in pig breeding, so he has requested a loan to start his business raising and selling hogs. His goal is to apply his knowledge and generate an income to maintain his household.
He dreams of having a large pig farm and becoming the largest meat dealer in the area. With this loan, he will buy two pregnant sows and make improvements to the corrals.

loans.use: to buy two pregnant hogs and to make modifications to the corrals.

loans.name: Las Princesas Group

texts.es:
El grupo está conformado por ocho mujeres muy trabajadoras y responsables pero sobretodo muy alegres siempre muy sonrientes ellas se conocen desde hace varios años en la comunidad donde viven es muy tranquila, Las integrantes del grupo platican que decidieron ponerle el nombre de las princesas porque se consideran muy bonitas. Doña Agustina es la representante del grupo de cariño le dicen Gutis tiene 42 años de edad está casada desde hace 11 años con el señor Bernardo quien trabaja como albañil juntos han formado una familia con tres niños los cuales asisten a la escuela, Doña Gutis tiene un taller de costura desde hace nueve años la inicio porque anteriormente trabajo en una fábrica de ropa pero decidió iniciar su propio negocio también tomo algunos cursos para mejorar la calidad de su trabajo, ella elabora los conjuntos de pants pero también hace composturas sus clientas hacen sus pedidos con tiempo de anticipación, la señora Gutis realiza las prendas por pedido y las composturas que le piden.
Doña Gutis platica que a pesar de gran esfuerzo que hace para realizar su trabajo muchas veces sus ganancias son muy pocas es por eso que también se dedica a la crianza y engorda de cerdos para su venta lo que significa un ingreso más a su hogar, En el taller de costura no tiene ninguna dificultad todo va muy bien solo que una de sus maquinas está descompuesta pero por eso mismo está solicitando el crédito para darle mantenimiento a su máquina y para comprar materia prima como hilos, tela, agujas, entre diferentes tipos de botones. El sueño de Gutis ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente ella está dispuesta seguir trabajando en su taller de costura y con la cría de sus cerdos para ayudar con sus gastos de educación, así como Doña Gutis tiene sueños las demás integrantes es por eso que están solicitando crédito a la institución para poder invertir en sus actividades económicas, Gabriela invertirá en ropa interior, Domitila, Graciela, Arely invertirán en borregos, Fany en la venta de tortillas y Constantina invertirá en su taller de costura, Ellas están muy contentas y agradecidas con Vision Fund y KIVA por el crédito otorgado porque para sus negocios será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by eight hard-working, responsible women. They are above all very cheerful and always smiling. They have known each other for several years from the community where they live, which is very peaceful.
The members of the group chose the name "princesas" (princesses) for the communal bank because they consider themselves pretty.
Agustina is the representative of the group. She is affectionately nicknamed Gutis. She is 42 years old and has been married for 11 years to Bernardo, who works as a construction worker. Together they have 3 children who are attending school.
Gutis has had a sewing workshop for 9 years. She opened it because she had worked in a clothing factory but decided to start her own business. She also took some courses to improve the quality of her work. She makes suits but also does fittings and alterations. Her customers make their orders in advance and Gutis works upon request on the garments and alterations previously ordered.
Gutis says that despite the amount of effort invested in her work, sometimes her earnings are very meager, so she also breeds and fattens pigs, as an additional source of income.
In her sewing workshop everything is going well, except for one of her sewing machines which broke down. She is asking for this loan to repair the machine, and also to buy raw materials such as thread, fabric, needles and different types of buttons.
Gutis' dream is to see her children with a professional career and she is willing to keep working in her sewing workshop and breeding pigs to help with the educational expenses of her children.
Just like Gutis, the other members of the "princesas" communal bank also have dreams and this is why they are asking for loans. Gabriela will buy underwear, Domitila, Graciela and Arely will invest in the purchase of lambs, Fany will invest in her tortilla selling business and Constantina will use the money for her sewing workshop.
They are pleased and grateful to the field partner, Vision Fund, and Kiva for the loans that will be very helpful for their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, needles, buttons and invest in the maintenance of sewing machines.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es: Ramón es un joven muy trabajador responsable con sus obligaciones vive en una comunidad muy tranquila donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican al comercio la venta de fantasía, pan , pollos, pan, que tengan alguna tienda de abarrotes, la venta de nopales podría decirse que es una comunidad activamente económica. Ramón tiene 27años de edad está casado tiempo desde hace con Marisol juntos han formado una familia con tres niños de los cuales ninguno aun asiste a la escuela Ramón se dedica al cultivo de nopales desde hace cinco años inicio con su cultivo porque quería de alguna manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia platica que el nopal lo siembra en matas medianas las siembra los cuida durante una año para ponerlas en venta durante su crecimiento Ramón necesita abonar el nopal, regarlas cada vez que necesiten, cuidarlas de las nevadas porque muchas veces puede quemar el cultivo lo que significa perdida de ganancia e inversión esta vez está solicitando el crédito para comprar abono para sus plantas de nopal. Ramón cuenta que le va muy bien con el cultivo de sus  nopales solo que muchas veces le hace falta dinero para mantener en buen estado su platico le hace falta abono, platico para cuidarlas de las nevadas, que caen en le mes de diciembre pero de ahí en fuera nada es imposible para lograr buenas ventas durante el mes de marzo, abril y mayo. Se dedica a vender en las plazas junto con su esposa Marisol. La meta de Ramón es lograr que un dia el llegue a tener grandes invernaderos porque por el momento solo tiene micro túneles los cuales son mas pequeños situación que no le permite cultivar en grandes números sus nopales. Aunque tener invernaderos mas grandes implican más gastos pero está muy contento con el crédito que le otorgaron porque asi podrá avanzar poco a poco y algún día lograr su sueño así su familia tendrá una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ramón is young, hard-working, and responsible with his obligations. He lives in a very peaceful community where the majority of residents work in commerce, selling costumes, chicken, bread, groceries, and prickly pear; it can easily be seen that this community is economically active. Ramón is 27 and has been married to Marisol for some time now. Together they have built a family with three children, none of whom are currently in school. Ramón has cultivated prickly pear for five years. He started this work because he wanted to improve his family's quality of life somehow. He says that he plants the prickly pear in medium-sized bushes. He takes care of them for one year. In order to sell them, Ramón needs to fertilize them while they are growing. He also needs to water them whenever they need it, and keep them safe from snowfall; often, this can burn the plants, meaning a loss of income and investment. 
Ramón is requesting a loan for the purchase of fertilizer for his prickly pear plants. He says that the cultivation of these plants is going very well for him, except that he is often in need of money to keep them in good condition. He needs fertilizer, he says, in order to care for them during the December snowfall, but after that it's never impossible to get good sales during the months of March, April, and May.
Ramón and Marisol sell the plants in the plazas together. His goal is to one day have large greenhouses; at the moment he only has small greenhouse spaces, which does not allow him to cultivate on a larger scale; however, having larger greenhouses means more costs. He is very happy with this loan, because this way he will be able to move forward bit by bit and one day reach his dream, and his family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his prickly pear plants.

loans.name: Hernándo De Jesús

texts.es: Hernando de 63 años de edad, trabajó por más de 27 años como conductor, pero debió suspender su labor debido a una fractura en su brazo derecho. Manifiesta ser una persona activa y con muchos deseos de laborar. Razón que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito para crear una carnicería, oficio que aprendió gracias a sus amigos que se dedican a la misma actividad. Su mayor sueño es continuar garantizándole a su familia una vida digna y sus dos hijas de 19 y 15 años una buena educación. Invertirá el crédito en adecuaciones locativas, pintura, compra de cortina metálica, vitrina, congelador, cuchillos y carne de res, cerdo y pollo.
texts.en:
Hernando, age 63, worked for over 27 years as a driver.  However, he had to suspend his work due to a fracture in his right arm.  He indicates that he is an active person with a great desire to work.  

This is the reason that has driven him to request a loan to create a butcher business.  He learned this trade thanks to his friends, who devote themselves to the same business activity.

His biggest dream is to ensure his family has a decent life and his two daughters, ages 19 and 15, have a good education.  He will use the loan on improvements and paint.  He will buy a metal curtain, a display case, a freezer, knives, beef, and chicken.

loans.use: to make improvements and to buy paint, a metal curtain, a display case, a freezer, knives, and meat.

loans.name: Roslyn

texts.en:
Roslyn has lived in Lake Charles, Louisiana for many years and understands that everyone needs some rest and relaxation from time to time. As a graduate of Louisiana Institute of Massage Therapy in Lake Charles, the R & R Roslyn is referring to is massage therapy. Since 1998, Roslyn has been a licensed massage therapist in casino health clubs, area salons, and privately for client-scheduled appointments. 
 
Her expertise and focus include deep tissue, hot stone, and reflexology massage services.  Her journey to Accion Texas Inc. began when she applied, but was initially denied a loan. This did not discourage Roslyn, but rather encouraged her to address the situation and reapply. This time she was approved for a $5,450 loan for her start-up business, Mahogany Body Massage.  

Currently, she is the only part-time employee, and has been since the creation of the business two months ago. She anticipates hiring an additional part-time massage therapist to assist with the growing business. Part of the loan will also be used to renovate her space where she conducts the massages and to purchase oils, lotions, and towels for her massage services.  

Roslyn is excited about her future, business, and finding that perfect balance in her life.

loans.use: to purchase oils, lotions, and towels, and to renovate her space where she conducts the massages.

loans.name: Melynda

texts.en:
In her hometown of Ft. Hancock, 31-year-old Melynda operates Heart JM Transportation, a trucking company hauling oil field equipment.

She’s been in business since 2006, continuing with the family tradition. Her family and her husband’s family each have been in the industry all their lives. Melynda says, “It’s what we know.”

Melynda says their business is set apart from others by their customer service. “We have the experience,” she says. As Melynda tells, the couple takes care of what they’re hauling and are punctual.

To keep up with her business goals, Melynda needed a loan to repurchase a truck her husband previously owned while working for someone at a larger company. 

After learning about Accion Texas Inc. from one of their many clients, Melynda decided she would venture to ask them for a loan. Once she applied and was approved, Melynda decided to use her loan to repurchase the truck.

Working with Accion “was easy enough,” Melynda says. She plans to pay off her loan swiftly and is making her first payment before it’s due.

loans.use: to purchase a truck.

loans.name: Kantutitas De Franz Tamayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE FRANZ TAMAYO” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Trinidad es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas macramé, venta de chuño, tienda de carnicería, venta de tullmas, venta de dulces, venta de comida, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Trinidad es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, comenzando con poca mercadería.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, etc.) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro, le crédito, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Kantutitas de Franz Tamayo” Communal Bank will begin its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer. They are working with one of the organization's regional offices in Los Andes. The group is comprised of eight members and managed by a board of directors where Trinidad acts as the treasurer. The members of the communal bank carry out varied businesses including selling macrame blankets, selling freeze-dried potatoes, a butcher's shop, selling traditional hair pieces, selling sweets, selling food and selling sweaters.
The loans will benefit small micro-lenders, one of which is Trinidad. She has been a member of Pro Mujer for four years. She joined after being invited by a promoter from the institution who went to her house.
Trinidad has a food selling business which she started on her own, initially with very few goods. She will use the money from the loan to increase her working capital and purchase rice, noodles, etc. wholesale from distributors. She will then prepare the food and sell it at her selling place. This way of doing business allows her to generate income to provide for her family. She is married and has 5 children.
When asked about what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the savings, the loans, the training offered and the health area.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Kenneth

texts.en:
Kenneth sells frozen goods through his business, W's Meats and Seafood Distribution Company, a business he started about two decades ago.  

According to his website, “Our goal has always been to provide our customers with quality meats and seafood at low prices.” Serving his hometown of Houston and its surrounding areas, Kenneth delivers to customers Monday through Saturday until 5:00 p.m., offering T-bone steak, catfish fillet, oxtail, shrimp, beef patties, bacon, pork chops, ribeye steaks, tilapia fillets, crawfish, catfish nuggets and homemade sausage made from chicken and beef.

After hearing about Accion Texas Inc. from an Accion employee, Kenneth decided to apply for a loan to take his business and team of three to the next level. Once he was approved, Kenneth purchased more meats and a freezer to increase inventory and allow for customer growth. He is also using the loan to better market his business.

The 53-year-old says without the loan, his business would not be able to meet its growing demand, and he would struggle to pay his current employees. He also says it would slow his current hiring process. Kenneth plans to hire one more full-time and two more part-time employees.

loans.use: to purchase more food and a freezer.

loans.name: Gladiadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GLADIADORAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Blanca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de verduras, venta de papa y chuño, taller de calzados, venta de queso, venta de comida, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Blanca es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de zapatos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió desde que convive con su pareja, ya que él tenía este oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cuero) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el grupo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The Gladiadoras communal bank will begin its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Centro Focal.  It is comprised of eight members, and it is run by a board of directors.  Blanca is the president.  The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied.  Among them are selling clothes, selling vegetables, selling potatoes and ‘chuño’ [freeze-dried potatoes], a cobbler shop, selling cheese, selling food, and a  mechanic shop.

The loan that they will take will benefit small businesswomen where Blanca is a member.  She says that she has been part of Pro Mujer for two cycles.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business that is a cobbler shop.  She says that she undertook this business when she started living with her life partner because this was also his trade.

The loan that she will now take is to increase capital (to buy leather) that she will get at the wholesale stores in the city of La Paz.  She will later make and sell at her fixed stand.  This way of working will allow her to generate resources to support the family.  She is in a common-law marriage and has one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the group she works with.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to upgrade his computer to allow for better digital edits.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles es una mujer de 44 años, ella vive en Paraíso de Pocosol, es casada y tiene tres hijos, se dedica desde hace más de 10 años a la elaboración de queso, oficio que aprendió de sus padres.

Ella con el dinero del crédito desea comprar un toro para mejorar el ganado que ya posee, así obtendría mejor calidad de crías y mayor cantidad de leche; y con esto una mejor calidad en el queso que elabora.

María de los Ángeles con el ingreso de la venta de queso ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, el cual trabaja como guarda de seguridad privado y los ingresos que recibe son para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, especialmente en la educación de sus tres hijos, es por esto que con el desarrollo de este proyecto ella estima que pueda tener ingresos mayores a los actuales y así tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia. 

El trabajo que realiza la señora María de los Ángeles la hace sentirse una persona realizada y muy orgullosa de sí misma, ya que la actividad a la que se dedica le genera ingresos propios y además con esto puede mantener a su familia.

Los clientes de ella en este momento es un comprador de queso únicamente, su idea es mejorar la raza de sus animales, para así mejorar la productividad y que pueda llegar a vender directamente su producto a personas de la comunidad y lugares cercanos y así incrementar sus ingresos y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Paraíso in Pocosol. She is married and has three children. For more than ten years she has made a living making cheese, an occupation she learned from her parents. 

With the money from the loan she wants to buy a bull to improve the cattle she already has, improve the quality of their offspring, and increase her milk production. With this she will make a higher quality cheese.

With the income from the sale of cheese María de los Ángeles she will help her husband with the household expenses. He works as a private security guard and the income he makes is used to cover the basic necessities of their family, especially in educating their three children. That is why she believes that the development of this business that will provide more income than she currently has and she will have a better quality of life together with her family. The work that María de los Ángeles does makes her feel fulfilled and very proud of herself as it is a business that generates her own income and she will be able to support her family. 

Right now, her customer is just one cheese buyer. Her idea is to improve her animal stock and in that way improve her productivity so that she can sell her products directly to people in the community and from nearby places. In turn her income will increase and she can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a bull to improve her cattle stock.

loans.name: Las Ocho Rositas De Escoma Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS OCHO ROSITAS DE ESCOMA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, producción y venta de hortalizas, tienda de barrio, producción de papa y chuño, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justina es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de pescado; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su pareja, ya que la familia de él trabajaba en este rubro, posteriormente decidieron trabajar con el mismo oficio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la renovación de herramientas (compra de red de  pesca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la lo instalará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
“Las Ocho Rositas de Escoma” [The Eight Little Roses of Escoma] Communal Bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer and they are working with the organization’s regional office in Achacachi.  The group is comprised of eight members and is headed by a board of directors where Justina is the president.  The members of the communal bank are engaged in varied businesses including producing and selling potatoes, producing and selling vegetables, owning a neighborhood store, producing and selling potatoes and potato starch, and selling livestock.  

The loan they are requesting will benefit women, such as Justina, who own small businesses.   She states that she is new to Pro Mujer and joined at the invitation of a promoter that visited her in her home.  Currently, she has a business selling fish and related that she learned it from her partner whose family worked in this trade.  Later, they decided to work in the same trade.

The loan she is taking out now is for the repair of tools and the purchase of a fishing net that she will acquire at the city fair in El Alto and later, she will set up it up in her sales space.  This type of work allows her to generate income for her household in the best possible way as she is in a common-law marriage and has five children.  When she was asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, she responded that she liked the training in health and loans.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Jhon Edison

texts.es: Jhon, tiene 24 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre pujante y luchador, su perseverancia es su mayor cualidad. Asegura que uno de sus mayores sueños es tener su propio negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, motivo por el cual hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de la canasta familiar y crear su propia tienda general. Desea poder posicionarse dentro del mercado local y convertirse en un gran proveedor de alimentos para su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jhon is 24 years old. He is known as a robust and determined man; perseverance is his greatest quality. 

Jhon asserts that one of his greatest dreams is to have his own business and to improve his family's quality of life, which is why he is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of basic household staples to open his own general store. He hopes to be able to position himself in the local market and become a major supplier of food for his community.

loans.use: to purchase everyday household staples.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana tiene 31 años de edad es una mujer soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a ellos y sus dos hermanos.Roxana se dedica a la  venta de comestibles, ropas, peluches, y otros accesorios, lleva en este negocio un promedio de 9 meses y lo realiza completamente sola ya que desea mejorar su calidad de vida y ahorrar lo necesario para independizarse. Roxana espera seguir creciendo y hacer crecer su negocio, ofreciendo un buen servicio al cliente y mejorar sus productos .Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que esta muy contenta y agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido el cual le ayudará a ampliar su negocio y seguir adelante.
Roxana, invertirá el dinero solicitado en comprar  mercadería tales como ropas , peluches y otros accesorios para así dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Roxana is a 31-year-old single mother who lives in her parents' home with her parents and her two siblings. 

Roxana earns her living selling food, clothing, stuffed toys, and other items. She has had this business for about nine moth; she runs it completely by herself, as she wants to improve her quality of life and save up what she needs to live independently. 

Roxana hopes to continue growing and making her business grow by offering her customers good service and by improving her inventory. This is her first loan with Kiva; she is very happy and grateful for the financial support she has received, which will help her to expand her business and keep it going. 

Roxana will invest the requested money in the purchase of merchandise like clothing, stuffed toys, and other items to invigorate her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing, stuffed toys, and other items.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan es una persona muy alegre que siempre ha tratado de ser muy resposnsable en cuanto a su trabajo. Él tiene 34 años de edad y esta casado con la señora Ángeles desde hace 14 años; juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos los cuales van a la escuela. Don Juan tiene una carpintería donde realiza muebles para el hogar como puertas, escaleras, colocadores, etc. bromeando comentó "Puedo hacer cualquier cosa, desde palillos hasta el arca de Noe". Don Juan platica que inicio su negocio por necesidad ya que el trabajaba anteriormente en una carpintería, fue así como aprendió, pero le gustaba mucho tanto que decidió iniciar su propio negocio, cuenta que no tiene dificultades solo que hay días en las que les hace falta un poco mas de dinero para poder conseguir su material pero gracias al crédito le ayudara mucho para sacar algunos pedidos que tiene pendientes.
Esta vez está solicitando un crédito más alto para comprar más madera para la elaboración de sus muebles, platica que el precio de la madera se ha elevado por lo que le ha dificultado comprar madera, triplay, herrajes, etc. pero gracias al crédito podrá comprar la madera, El señor Carlos está muy agradecido porque lleva varios ciclos solicitando crédito a VisionFund y KIVA, créditos que ha invertido en su carpintería lo que le ha generado más trabajo, situación del cual se siente muy orgulloso porque ha podido contratar a más personas para trabajar en su carpintería aunque Don Juan está muy decidido a llegar a tener una carpintería más grande donde tenga más herramienta y todas las instalaciones necesarias para dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Juan is a very cheerful person who always tries to be responsible in his work.  He is 34 years old and has been married to his wife, Ángeles, for fourteen years.  Together, they have formed a family with four children who attend school.  Juan has a carpentry shop where he makes home furniture such as doors, staircases, wood flooring, and other items.  He jokingly commented, “I can make anything, from toothpicks to Noah’s Ark”.  Juan says that he started his business from necessity.  Previously, he worked as a carpenter and this is how he learned, but he liked it so much that he decided to start his own business.  He says that he doesn’t have difficulties except that there are days when he needs a little more money to get his material.  But thanks to the loan, he will be able to complete some orders that are pending.  

This time he is requesting a loan for a higher amount to buy more wood to make his furniture.  He says that the price of wood has gone up and this has made it difficult to purchase wood, plywood, hardware, and other supplies.  But thanks to the loan, he will be able to purchase the wood.  Carlos is very grateful because he has gone through many loan cycles with VisionFund and Kiva.  He has invested the loans in his carpentry shop, which has generated more work for him. He is very proud of this result because he has been able to hire more people to work in his shop.  Juan is very determined to have a larger carpenter’s shop where he will have more woodworking tools and all the facilities necessary to provide better service.

loans.use: to buy lumber.

location.town: San Juan Jalpa, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Eduardo Francisco

texts.es:
Eduardo tien 28 años es soltero vive con los padres en San Jose de Chimbo no tiene hijos.

Eduardo se dedica a pelar mote en una asociacion que es de familiares. El dinero lo solicita para la compra de electrodomesticos como una refrigeradora.

El sueño es tener dinero para tener todas las comodidades y vivir bien.

En los momentos libres le gusta compartir en familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo, age 28, is single, and he lives with his parents in San Jose de Chimbo.  He does not have children.  Eduardo shells and dries corn in a family association.  

The money he is requesting is to buy appliances like a refrigerator.

His dream is to have money in order to have all of the comforts and to live well.

He likes to share his free time with his family.

loans.use: to buy appliances like a refrigerator.

loans.name: Sabrina Beatriz

texts.es:
Sabrina,  tiene 23 años de edad, está casada y su esposo tiene 25 años de edad, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 3 y 5 años. Ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, oficio que lo aprendió con su madre y lo realiza desde hace cinco años de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar cerdos y concentrado para engordarlos; esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar sus inventarios y con ello obtener mayores utilidades.
Su sueño es fortalecer  más su negocio y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Sabrina is 23 years old and married; her husband is 25 years old. She is enjoying her two children, who are 3 and 5 years old. She earns her living raising pigs, a trade that she learned from her mother. She has done this work for five years from Monday to Sunday. 

The loan that she requires will allow her to buy pigs and concentrated feed to fatten them; this investment will help her to increase her inventory and thus obtain better earnings.

Her dream is to strengthen her business more and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and the feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, vive con su familia. El se dedica a la agricultura de granos basicos, el oficio lo apredio de su familia. El prestamo que requiere  le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas necesarios para llevar cabo la siembra, tales como: abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas  y pago de mano de obra.
Su sueño es obtener ingresos y con las utilidades invertirlas en los gastos del hogar, asimismo brindarle una mejora calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto lives with his family.  He grows basic grains, the trade he learned from his family.

The loan that he needs will allow him to buy the agricultural supplies needed for sowing.  He will buy things like fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and he will pay for the labor.

His dream is to get income and to use the profits for the household expenses.  He will also provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 35-years-old and married with two children, who are both in school. Eden works very hard to provide for them.

Eden runs a business buying and selling electrical supplies in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 29500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional electrical supplies to sell.

Eden has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional electrical supplies to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48-years-old and married with seven children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional household goods such as shampoo, milk, sugar, spices and soft drinks to sell.

Gina has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase household goods such as shampoo, milk, sugar, spices and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jocelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens.  Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items like canned goods, soap, shampoo, noodles, sugar, milk, etc. to sell for her general store business.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like canned goods, soap, shampoo, noodles, sugar, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase food and household goods, such as soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods, to sell in her general store. Josephine has been in this business for 6 years, and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods to sell, including soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 37 years old, married, and has five children. She works hard to provide for her family, and runs a direct-sale Avon business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years, and earns additional income from making furniture. She requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell.

Nancy has borrowed and repaid 15 loans through NWTF prior to this loan. Her goal is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell

loans.name: La Luz Del Saber Group

texts.es:
El grupo “La Luz del Saber” está ubicado en una comunidad muy tranquila reconocida por sus culturas y tradiciones mazahuas, las personas de esa comunidad aun hablan la lengua materna "mazahua". El grupo esta integrando por nueve personas son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables.
Don Ángel, Lilia, Moisés, Filiberta, Ofelia, Isabel, David, Claudia decidieron ponerle el nombre porque para ellos era iniciar en un nuevo crédito nunca habían tenido conocimiento sobre el tema. 
Doña Gregoria es integrante del grupo es una señora muy alegre pero sobretodo muy trabajadora, tiene 58 años de edad es una mujer viuda ya no tiene ningún hijo dependiente sin embargo ella es quien también se encarga de los gastos de su nieto, Doña Gregoria tiene una tienda de abarrotes desde hace 38 años la inicio porque antes no había tiendas donde se pudiera comprar abarrotes fue como su esposo y Doña Gregoria decidieron poner la tienda de abarrotes esta vez está solicitando el crédito para abastecer su tienda de abarrotes, comprará leche, refrescos, pan, huevo, azúcar, sal etc. solo que su única dificultad en estos momentos es la mucha competencia en su comunidad por lo que ha bajado mucho las ventas.
En la tienda de Doña Gregoria le hace falta un refrigerador para iniciar a vender productos lácteos, yogurths, crema, queso, jamón etc.  lo que le ayudaría a levantar sus ganancias y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. La única meta de Doña Gregoria es volver a tener llena su tienda de abarrotes tener de todo y nunca más decirle a su clientes no tengo lo que me estas pidiendo. Así como Doña Lilia, Moisés, Ángel, Filiberta, Ofelia, Isabel invertirán en productos de jarcieria. Aurora invertirá en su tienda de abarrotes, Claudia y David invertirán en su taxi.
texts.en:
The ‘La Luz del Saber’ [The Light of Knowledge] group is located in a very peaceful community that is known for its Mazahuas culture and traditions.  The people in this community still speak the mother tongue, Mazahua.  The group is comprised of nine people who are very hard-working and responsible people.  Ángel, Lilia, Moisés, Filiberta, Ofelia, Isabel, David, and Claudia decided upon the name because for them, upon starting a new loan, they had never had knowledge about the topic.

Gregoria is a member of the group.  She is a very happy woman, but above all, she is very hard-working.  She is a 58 year old widow.  She does not now have any dependent children.  However, she is also the one who takes care of her grandson’s expenses.

Gregoria has had a grocery store for 38 years.  She started it because there were not any stores where you could buy groceries.  That is how Gregoria and her husband decided to set up a grocery store.  This time she is requesting the loan to stock her grocery store.  She will buy milk, soft drinks, bread, eggs, sugar, and salt, etc.  The only difficulty she currently has is the great amount of competition in her community, which has greatly reduced her sales.

Gregoria needs a refrigerator in her store in order to start selling dairy products, yogurt, cream, cheese, and ham, etc.  This would help her to increase her profits and, this way, improve her family’s quality of life.  Gregoria’s only goal is to have her grocery store full again, to have everything, and to never again tell her customers that she does not have what they are asking for.

Lilia, Moisés, Ángel, Filiberta, Ofelia, and Isabel will buy household products.  Aurora will invest in her grocery store.  Claudia and David will invest in their taxi.

loans.use: to buy salt, sugar, soft drinks, bread, eggs, and milk.

location.town: Emilio Portes Gil, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Josie works hard to support her family.

Josie has a general store business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Josie is borrowing 10,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to restock her store with food and household goods such as soft drinks, canned goods, candy, bread and spices to sell.

Josie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with food and household goods such as soft drinks, canned goods, candy, bread and spices to sell.

loans.name: Juvelyn

texts.en:
Juvelyn is 43-years-old and married with two children.

Juvelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 35,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, sugar, milk, soft drinks and noodles.

Juvelyn has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

Juvelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell such as canned goods, sugar, milk, soft drinks and noodles.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 35 years old and married. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from direct-selling Avon and Natasha products. Lorna is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase materials for the construction of pigpens for business.

She is working tirelessly toward her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the construction of pigpens

loans.name: Jesus Salvador

texts.es:
Jesus tiene 37 años es casado tiene dos hijos vive con la esposa y con los hijos en San Jose de Chimbo.

Jesus tiene una camioneta en donde trabaja realizando fletes en una cooperativa de transporte que se llama tres de marzo el dinero lo solicita para reparar la camioneta y comprar algunos repuestos que le faltan que es la unica fuente de ingresos.

El credito le ayudado a mejorar el estado en el que esta el vehiculo.

El sueño de Jesus es tener dinero para poder comprar otro vehiculo. En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
Jesus is 37 years old, married and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in San Jose de Chimbo.

Jesus has a truck which he uses to make deliveries as part of a transport cooperative called "Tres de Marzo". He is requesting the money in order to repair the truck and buy some needed replacement parts, as it is his sole source of income. The loan will help him to improve the condition of his vehicle.

Jesus' dream is to have the money to buy another vehicle. In his free time he likes to go for a walk with his family.

loans.use: To repair his truck and buy some needed replacement parts.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 32 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from raising poultry. Melinda is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional varieties of seeds, fertilizers, and farm equipment for her business.

Melinda is working tirelessly toward her dream of building and expanding her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional varieties of seeds, fertilizers, and farm equipment for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 65 years old, married, and has one child. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and has been in this business for one year. She earns additional income from buying and selling fruit. Lydia is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other items necessary for farming.

Lydia is working tirelessly toward her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other items necessary for farming

loans.name: La Primera Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LA PRIMERA”  iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Hilda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura, venta de tullmas, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, venta de dulces, venta de sábanas, cría y venta de animales, venta de shampoo, venta de refrescos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Hilda es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura y venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto fijo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el crédito y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “LA PRIMERA” (The First) community bank will begin its sixteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata Regional Office.  It is made up of nine members and is managed by a board of which Hilda is the President.
