The businesses that the members of the group operate are varied and include: sewing, sale of traditional woven ornaments for braids, neighborhood store, clothing sales, candy sales, linen sales, raising and sale of animals, shampoo sales, and beverage sales.  

The loan that they are requesting will benefit small business owners, including Hilda.  She indicates that ten years ago, she joined Pro Mujer at the invitation of a friend who is also a member of the organization.  Currently, she has a business sewing and selling clothing.  She learned this trade through her own initiative many years ago.

The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital (to purchase fabric) which she will acquire wholesale in the city of La Paz and then make and sell (her clothing) in her store.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family since she is a widow and has five children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she appreciates the trainings, the loans, and the health benefits.

loans.use: to purchase fabric.

loans.name: Milagro

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Milagro works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from salt retail. Milagro is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy-and-sell vegetables business.

Milagro has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Chora

texts.en:
Chora is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has been engaged in the mat-weaving business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Chora is asking for a loan to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, dye and others. Through this, she will be able to weave more mats and increase her sales and income. In the future, Chora hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for mat weaving like romblon, dye and others.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 40-year-old married mother of six children from Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 20 years. 

Judith is requesting a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. 

In the future, Judith hopes to make her business successful and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks, and other fishing materials

loans.name: Evolution 3 (2) Group

texts.en:
Faustin, age 58, is married and has five children ages 5 to 20 years old. All five of his children attend school. 

Faustin is representing the Evolution 3 (2) group. He has a food stall where he sell a variety of items, and will use his portion of the group's loan to pay for canned goods and gasoline to sell. Many people burn gasoline in their lamps at home when the electricity is out. 

His business strategy is to take out loans from HOPE and to be a good manager of the funds. He prides himself on the organization of his business and finances. 

Faustin has received three loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. His goal is to continue to develop his business.

loans.use: to pay for canned goods and gasoline

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel, de oficio comerciante, casado, originario de Granada, dice que los prestamos son de gran ayuda si se sabe administrar y es lo que ha hecho el pues le han permitido comprar sillas, mesas y paraguas accesorios que ha necesitado su negocio para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes y está muy agradecido. 
Actualmente este crédito lo utilizara para comprar pintura, vasos, platos, chicharrón, yuca y repollo.  Poco a poco quiere ir ampliando más su kiosco además de ir  ahorrando para la vejez de su esposa y el.
texts.en:
Manuel, a businessman by trade, is married and a native of Granada. He says that the loans are of great help if one knows how to manage, and this is what he has done, since they have allowed him to buy chairs, tables, and umbrellas, accessories that his business has needed so that he can give better service to his customers, and he is very grateful.

Now he will use this loan to but paint, glasses, plates, pork rinds, yucca, and cabbage. Little by little he wants to continue expanding his kiosk in addition to saving for his and his wife's old age.

loans.use: to buy paint, glasses, plates, pork rinds, yucca, and cabbage

loans.name: Evolution 3 (1) Group

texts.en:
Gustave, age 56, is married with nine children, aged 11 to 37 years old. He has three children attending high school and three attending university. He is representing the Evolution 3 (1) group. Gustave has a food stall where he sells a variety of food and household items. He will use the loan to buy food products and soap. His business strategy is to be gentle and helpful with the customers.

Gustave has received one previous loan from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to continue his business far into the future. He wants his children to finish their education.

loans.use: to pay for a variety of food products and soap.

loans.name: Tout Va Bien 2 Group

texts.en:
Chrisly, age 34, is single with no children. He is representing the Tout Va Bien 2 group. Chrisly has a food stall where he sells a variety of food and household items. He has had this business for 15 years! He started as a young boy and has continued to grow his business. He will use the loans to buy canned good, oil, and rice. His business strategy is to be nice and helpful to his customers. 

Chrisly has received one previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He would like to open a second food stall in the future.

loans.use: to pay for canned goods, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Tout Va Bien 1 Group

texts.en:
Dieudonne, age 46, is single with three children, aged 9 to 17 years old. All of his children are attending school. He is representing the Tout Va Bien 1 group. Dieudonne sells phone cards and credit in the market. He has had this business for two years. He has also recently started a small food stall where he sells a variety of snack foods. He will use the loan to buy more phone cards and credit as well as two new cell phones. He uses these cell phones to transfer phone minutes electronically to his customers. His business strategy is to have a large sign on a busy avenue that publicizes his business. 

Dieudonne has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to become a supplier of phone cards, where he sells them in bulk to vendors.

loans.use: to pay for phone cards and credit and two new cell phones.

loans.name: Manuel Mesias

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 36 años de edad es viudo no tiene hijos, vive con unos familiares en Chimbo provincia Bolívar.

Manuel es Albañil realiza construcciones de casas, departamentos. Solicita el crédito para comprar una lavadora y una cocina. 
Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario para la casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es la competencia y el mal clima. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
Manuel is 36 years old, and is a widower with no children.  He lives with some family members in Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar.

Manuel is a mason who constructs houses and apartments.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy a washing machine and stove.  With the help of this loan he will be able to buy needed items for his home.  The challenges that he faces are competition and the weather.  In his free time he likes to play volleyball.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and a stove.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stationary, toner and a photocopier.

loans.name: La Reconnaissance 2 Group

texts.en:
Zephyrun, age 45, is married with two children, aged 15 and 18 years old. They are both attending school. He is representing the La Reconnaissance 2 group. Zephyrun grows a variety of vegetables to sell to vendors in the market. He has been doing this for over five years. He will use the loan to buy farming products, such as seeds. His business strategy is to continue to develop and grow his business. 

Zephyrun has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. In the future, he wants to become a great businessman.

loans.use: to pay for farming products and seeds.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 46 años de edad vive acompañada de su esposo y sus dos hijos, en su casa propia.Marleni se dedica a brindar servicios de confección, hace 15 años que viene realizando esta actividad y se inició buscando mejorar sus ingresos y aportar con lo gastos del hogar por eso decidió estudiar corte y confección en centro de educación ocupacional, actualmente tiene muchos clientes ya que es una mujer creativa y empeñosa. Como todo negocio que tiene sus altibajos, Marleni paso por muchas dificultades ya que en un principio su confección era defectuosa y no gustaba a sus clientes pero con la experiencia pudo mejorar su arte.Por lo que ahora tiene muy buenos ingresos ecónomicos con los cuales ayuda a su esposo a mantener a su familia estable. Este es el primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido que le ayudara para mejorar su negocio. 
El dinero solicitado de S/.4000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos , agujas , botones y otros materiales que son usados en la confección de sus prendas.
texts.en:
Marleni is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in their own home.  Marleni has dedicated her time to providing sewing services for the last 15 years. She began looking for a way to improve their income and help cover the household costs.  For this reason, she decided to study dressmaking in the local occupational center.  Today she has many customers because she is a woman who is creative and earnest.  As every business has its ups and downs, Marleni has been through many difficulties.  In the beginning some of her work was defective and she didn't like her customers, but through this experience she has been able to improve in the art of dressmaking.  Now she earns very good income, with which she helps her husband maintain their family stability.  

This is Marleni's first Kiva loan, and she is very grateful for the economic help that she is receiving which will help her to improve her business.  With this 4,000 Peruvian Soles, Marleni will invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, needles, buttons and other materials that are used in the manufacture of garments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, elastic, buttons, needles and other sewing materials.

loans.name: La Reconnaissance 1 Group

texts.en:
Basile, age 45, is married with four children, ages 4 to 24 years old. He has three children attending school. He is representing the La Reconnaissance 1 group. Basile has a butcher shop and has been operating for over 10 years. He will use the loan to buy a variety of meat and manioc to sell. Manioc is a popular starchy food in Congo made from the roots of the cassava plant. His business strategy is to be friendly with the customers and offer competitive prices. 

Basile has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He would like to travel abroad in order the buy merchandise to sell in Congo.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of meat and manioc.

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu 2 Group

texts.en:
Esperance, age 46, is single with two daughters, ages 21 and 27 years old. The youngest attends a university. She is representing the La Gloire de Dieu 2 group.

Esperance bakes and sells cakes. She has been doing this for a year. She will use the loan to buy sacks of flour and sugar, butter, milk, and firewood. Her business strategy is to bake good cakes and use quality ingredients. She thinks it is important to offer good customer service. Esperance also prays for her business and feels that God has blessed her. 

She has received two previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to have a school supply store one day.

loans.use: to purchase flour and sugar, butter, milk, and firewood for her cake baking business.

loans.name: Johana Katerine

texts.es:
Johana es soltera no tiene hijos vive con sus padres en San Jose de Chimbo.

Se dedica al comercio de ropa informal para adultos y niños. La mercaderia commpra en Guayaquil y las vende en un local que arrienda. EL credito lo solicita para comprar mas mercaderia como pantalones, blusas, ropa interior entre otras cosas.

Su sueño es tener dinero para ponerse un almacen mas grande.

En los tiepos libres le gusta salir a bailar.
texts.en:
Johana is single and has no children.  She lives with her parents in San Jose de Chimbo.

She works at a store selling informal clothing for adults and children.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil and then sells it in her local market.  With this loan, she will buy merchandise like pants, blouses, and undergarments, among other things.

Her dream is to make enough money to have a bigger store.

In her free time, Johana likes to go out dancing.

loans.use: merchandise like pants, blouses, and undergarments, among other things.

loans.name: Yeison

texts.es: Yeison es un joven de 19 años de edad, emprendedor y con un gran futuro por delante. Con su carisma y empuje, desea iniciar con su proyecto de negocio, el cual le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades de crecer dentro del sector productivo. Aunque lo que le sobran son ganas e ideas, Yeison carece de recursos económicos para financiar la creación de su negocio dedicado a la venta bebidas y mecatos, motivo por el cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mesas, sillas y un refrigerador. Espera mejorar su calidad de vida y poder tener la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad e iniciar con su formación académica.
texts.en: Yeison is a young man of 19 years of age.  He is a businessman with a great future ahead of him.  With his charisma and drive, he wants to start his own business.  This will allow him better opportunities to grow in his sector of production.  Although he has the desire and ideas, Yeison is lacking the economic resources to finance his creation of a business dedicated to the sale of drinks and snacks.  This is why he is requesting a loan to invest in tables, chairs and a refrigerator.  He hopes to better his quality of life and to have the opportunity to go to college and start his education.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs and a refrigerator

loans.name: La Gloire De Dieu 1 Group

texts.en:
Janine, age 52, is married with two children, ages 24 and 32. She is representing the La Gloire de Dieu 1 group. 

Janine sells plastics in a local market. She has run this business for a little over a year. She will use the loan to increase her supply of plastics. Her business strategy is to be polite and helpful to all of her customers. 

Janine has received two previous loans from Kiva's partner, HOPE Congo. She has a good repayment record. She wants to continue to grow her plastics business. She hopes her children will be successful and happy in their lives.

loans.use: to purchase plastics to resell in the market.

loans.name: Sikama Group

texts.en:
Edwige, age 43, is married with three children, ages 9 to 16. All of her children attend school. She is representing the Sikama group. 

Edwige sells used clothing in the market. She has been doing this since 2011. She also has a small secondary business where she sells children's toys. She will use the loan to buy bales of used clothing from her supplier and more children's toys. 

Edwige has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She wants to build a large building and have a large store that sells a variety of items. She hopes her children will pursue their own businesses some day.

loans.use: to purchase bales of used clothing and toys to resell.

loans.name: La Colombe 2 Group

texts.en:
Marguerite, age 60, is married with six children, ages 23 to 42. She is representing the La Colombe 2 group. Marguerite makes and sells besap juice, a very popular fruity drink sold on the streets of Brazzaville. She has had this business for over 30 years. She has gained a valuable reputation in her community and many people come to her to buy besap. Her business strategy is to offer friendly customer service and give returning clients small gifts. 

Marguerite has received five previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She would like to travel to Chad, where besap originates from, and buy the products to make besap.

loans.use: to purchase juice mixes to sell in her stand.

loans.name: La Puissance 2 Group

texts.en:
Thierry, age 39, is married with two children, ages 3 and 5 years old. They are both enrolled in a preschool. He is representing the La Puissance 2 group. 

Thierry is quite the entrepreneur. He has a cellphone credit and phone card business, a photograph developing business, and a hair salon. He has been operating these businesses for 11 years. He will use the loan to reinforce each business. He will buy phone cards and credit, photo ink cartridges and paper, and hair salon products. His business strategy is to be diversified and offer good prices. 

Thierry has received four previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to start another activity in the future and continue his current activities.

loans.use: to pay for phone cards, photo ink cartridges, photo paper, and hair salon products.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol; este le permitirá  comprar abono, herbicidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a adquirir los insumos agrícolas necesarios en el momento adecuado para el cultivo; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Jose needs more working capital to continue investing in the cultivation of corn and beans.  This loan will permit him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides, among other things.

His previous loan helped him to acquire the necessary agricultural supplies at just the right time for growing.  His economic condition and family circumstances have improved since his last loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, fungicides, and insecticides.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es:
Gustavo de 44 años de edad, tiene una cancha de tejo en calidad de arrendamiento desde hace 9 meses. Negocio en el que decidió ubicar un kiosco para comercializar bebidas y mecatos con el fin de garantizar un mejor servicio y fidelizar sus clientes. Labora diariamente, de 9:00 am a 10 pm. 

Gracias a su actividad, su ingresos han mejorando considerablemente a igual que la calidad de vida de su grupo familiar. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y pintura para adecuar el local.
Sueña con brindarle a su hija de 5 años de edad, una buena educación y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 44 years old and has been renting a shuffleboard court for the last 9 months.  At this business he decided to open a kiosk which sells drinks and snacks so that he can guarantee better service and build customer loyalty.  He works every day from 9:00am to 10:00pm.

Thanks to this job, his income has improved considerably, as has his family's quality of life.  He is asking for this loan to invest in an assortment of drinks and snacks, as well as paint for his business premises.

He dreams of giving his 5 year old daughter a good education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of drinks and snacks, as well as paint for his business premises.

loans.name: La Colombe 1 Group

texts.en:
Jacques, age 63, is married with six children, ages 13 to 41. He has three children currently attending school. He is representing the La Colombe 1 group.

Jacques sells frozen foods and has been operating this business for 22 years. He has gained many loyal customers over the years. He will use the loan to buy frozen salt water fish. His business strategy is to buy in bulk from his supplier and sell the items individually. 

Jacques has received five previous loan from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to become a supplier one day and sell to vendors like himself.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell.

loans.name: La Puissance 1 Group

texts.en:
Yvon, age 40, is married with three children, aged 2 to 15 years old. He has two children currently attending school. He is representing the La Puissance 1 group. Yvon has a grocery stall where he sells a variety of things. He has been operating for nine years. He will use the loan to buy more rice, canned goods, and oil. His business strategy is to keep all the products his customers want stocked at all times. He has found that if you don't have a good consistent stock of merchandise customers quit coming. 

Yvon has received three previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. He has a good repayment record. He hopes to have an actual building for his store in the future. He wants his children to continue their education and find a good job.

loans.use: to pay for rice, canned goods, and oil.

loans.name: Francisco Jabier

texts.es:
Francisco, es un sencillo comerciante habitante de la ciudad de Granada, casado, padre de 3 hijos, él se dedica a la venta de bolsas y artículos plásticos, tiene 10 años en esta actividad. Empezó junto con su esposa vendiendo de manera ambulante, ofreciendo su mercadería a las pulperías, puestos de comida, de casa en casa. Hoy en día tiene un pequeño local donde comercializa sus productos. 
Está necesitando el financiamiento para comprar una moto la cual utilizara para repartir sus productos de manera más rápido y así transportar su mercadería y ahorrar evitando  pagar taxi diario para guardar sus productos. El desea ser distribuidor mayorista de artículos plásticos en la zona y así poder dar empleo a otras personas que al igual que él desea superarse cada día.
texts.en:
Francisco is a simple merchant who resides in the city of Granada.  He is married and is the father of 3 children.  He works selling bags and plastics.  He has worked in this business for 10 years.  He began working with his spouse as a street vendor, offering his merchandise at grocery stores, food stands, and from house to house.  Today he has a small shop where he sells his products.

Francisco needs financing to buy a motorcycle, which he will use to distribute his products in a faster manner.  With the motorcycle, he will transport his merchandise and will save money by not having to pay for taxi fare daily to transport his products.  He wants to be a major plastics distributor in his region so that he can employ other people, who, like Francisco, want to better their lives every day.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Jeison

texts.es: Jeison de 23 años de edad, es un joven que sabe como ganarse la vida, desde niño le gusta trabajar, asegura que su mayor reto es mejorar la calidad de vida de su madre. En la actualidad labora como cobrador en su localidad, pero se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de adquirir una motocicleta y tener un medio de transporte que le permita mejorar la productividad en su trabajo. Asegura que dicha inversión mejorará no sólo su calidad de vida sino la de su grupo familiar.
texts.en: Jeison is 23 years old.  He is a young man who knows how to make a living.  Since he was a boy, he has enjoyed working.  Improving his mother's quality of life is his biggest challenge.  Right now Jeison works as a debt collector in his town, but he is asking for this loan in order to acquire a motorcycle and have a better means of transportation, which will allow him to increase his productivity at work.  He is certain that this investment will not only improve his quality of life, but that of his family as well.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marta Gladis

texts.es:
Marta, requiere optar por un nuevo crédito para seguir invirtiendo en la agricultura y en la venta de alimentos; este le ayudara a comprar elotes, hoja de huerta para la elaboracion de tamales y asimismo comprar los materiales agrícolas necesarios para el cultivo tales como: abono, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, herbicidas y pago de mano de obra.
El préstamo anterior le permitió aumentar sus ganancias y las utilidades las invirtió en los gastos del hogar;  las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Marta is applying for a new loan to continue investing in agriculture and the sale of food.  This loan will help her to buy corn, hoja de huerta (leaves used to make tamales), and also to buy agricultural materials that are necessary for cultivation, like fertilizer, insecticides, pesticides, fungicides, herbicides and payment for farm labor.

Marta's previous loan helped her increase her profits, and she used those profits for her household expenses.  Her economic conditions and her family circumstances have improved since her last loan.

loans.use: to buy corn, hoja de huerta (leaves used to make tamales), fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide, fungicide, herbicide and to pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of seven grown-up children. Leonila has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. She helps her husband till their farm.

Leonila is asking for a loan to buy sacks for rice storage and fertilizer for the rice field. Through this, she will be able to improve their farm as well as their harvest. In the future, Leonila dreams of expanding their farming business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy sacks for rice storage, and fertilizer for the rice field

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita earns a living through her hog-raising business. She lives with her family in the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Lita is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs. Through this, she will be able to improve her business as well as her income.  Lita wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy feed for the pigs

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hard-working woman, running a sari-sari (variety) store to provide for her three children. Her stock includes food, ranging from canned goods and noodles to chips and snack foods. She also sells soap and detergents among others. Her husband is in the motorcycle transport business.
Marina is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages. Through this loan, she will be able to expand the variety of her stock and attract more customers in her store.
In the future, Marina dreams of making her business a success and having a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 64-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari or variety store selling various goods. This is the source of her income.
Nenita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able expand her stock and cater to more customers in her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, rice, noodles, soda and other beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a married woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 25 years now. This is the source of her income.

Martina is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Martina hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place in Ubay, Bohol. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and detergents, among other items. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her store and augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like rice, canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Ardian

texts.en:
Livestock is the activity that Ardian has been practicing in the last six years. Ardian wants to add another milk cow to his herd to increase milk production and this loan will help him to do just that. 

Ardian is forty years old and married with no children. The village where he lives and the surrounding areas are indeed poor. Residents are hard workers, but the majority of them can’t qualify for loans, even through microfinance institutions. In an attempt to tackle the poverty issues that are plaguing these villages,World Vision in collaboration with VisionFund Albania reached out to this commune with their Value Chain Projects, and Ardian was one of the selected beneficiaries.

loans.use: To buy a milk cow

loans.name: Frank

texts.en:
Frank sells drinks and also deals in the sales of provisions at Akpafu, Hohoe Township.  Frank has received schooling to senior high school level.  He is married and has 5 children. His wife is a petty trader. 

Frank has been selling drinks and provisions to support himself and his other family members for the past 20 years after he completed senior high school when he couldn’t continue. He is responsible for the general upkeep of the home. 


His loan will be used to buy different types of minerals, introduce the sale of water, and buy boxes of soap. He hopes to save and use the new profits from his expanded business to acquire a shop.

loans.use: to buy different types of minerals, introduce the sale of water, and buy boxes of soap.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Neang is 52 years old. She is married and resides with a mute child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than a year, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who makes an income of $4 daily. 

In order to improve her business, Neang is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase more fruits for resale. By doing so, she would earn more profit to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her store and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim is 30 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction foreman who makes an income of $10 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Yim is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase timber to manufacture a boat to sell. By doing so, she would be able to earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to build a house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase timber to manufacture a boat to sell

loans.name: Jelina

texts.en:
Jelina a villager in her mid-fifties who lives in rural central Albania. She is married and has three children who are in their twenties and are attending school. For the past twenty years, Jelina has been working in a small agricultural business that has generated enough income to meet her family’s day to day needs. She sells fresh produce in the city like a majority of residents from her village. They go down to the city every day and start selling from 6am to 2pm.  To increase her income, Jelina now wants to add one milking cow. 

Jelina has never before applied for a loan because she knew that without collateral it would be almost impossible to obtain one. Yet things changed recently: when the WVA and VFA launched the Integrated Loan Projects in her region, she was one of the beneficiaries selected to take advantage of such a loan.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Madame Daba est une vendeuse de petit déjeuner de profression. Elle est agé de 42 ans et évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans la vente de café et du pain. Mais avec la conjoncture, Daba voudrais faire une autre activité parallèle à celui de vendeuse de café c'est à dire faire du maraîchage. Ainsi elle sollicite ce pret pour acheter des intrants agricoles, des engrais, des produits; du fumier et de gazol pour commencer à cultiver son champs. Elle commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 13h et le soir elle va aux champs pour cultiver.Daba aide son mari sur les dépenses quotidiennes et à l'avenir elle souhaite avec l'augmentation des ses revenus acheter une voiture de transport.
texts.en:
Daba sells breakfast for a living. She is 42 years old and has been selling coffee and bread for ten years. But with the economy, Daba would like to do something else in parallel to this business--namely, market gardening. 

Thus, she is asking for this loan to buy farm inputs, fertilizers, other products, manure, and diesel in order to start cultivating her fields. She starts her day at 7 a.m. and finishes at 1 p.m. At night she goes to the fields to cultivate them. 

Daba helps her husband with the everyday expenses and in the future she would like to increase her earnings to buy a transport vehicle.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, other products, manure, and diesel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repairs to his truck so he can acquire more materials for his business.

loans.name: Dieynaba

texts.fr: Madame Dieynaba est une femme qui habite dans le meme quartier que se situe le Guichet . Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont le plus agé a 6ans et le plus jeune 3ans. Agée de 32ans Dieynaba évolue dans le commerce de tissus; elle une expérience de 10ans dans cet activité. Elle gère ses charges personnelles ainsi Dieynaba commence sa journée à 10h pour la terminer à 13h. Elle demande ce crédit de 100000 F pour subvenir à la demande de ces clients. A l'avenir, Dieynaba souhaite augmenter ses revenus et grace à l'aide de l'imcec ouvrir une ferme agricole.
texts.en:
Dieynaba, aged 32, lives in the same neighborhood as the bank.  She is married and the mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 3.  She sells fabrics.  She has a ten-year experience in this field and manages her own expenses.  She works from 10 AM until 1 PM.

She is requesting this loan of 100,000 francs to meet customer demand.  In the future, she would like to increase her income with the support of the UIMCEC.  She would also like to have a farm.

loans.use: to buy and resell fabrics and ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Mimoza

texts.en:
Mimoza is an Egyptian Albanian married mother of three teenage children.  She has been living in a rural part of south-central Albania for a very long time, unlike other members of her community who choose to live in the suburbs of major cities and sell second-hand items for a living. Not only that, but her focus has been on agriculture and she has been enjoying that.

Mimoza moved to the rural area some years back in an attempt to give her children a better life by practicing agriculture and she has no regrets according to her. “I am the only one from my community living here, and I like it. I like living and doing something different from my community,” Mimoza said.

This integrated project loan will give Mimoza the opportunity to buy a dairy cow and some food for her animals.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and food for her animals

loans.name: Fine

texts.en:
Fine was recently approved for an integrated project loan in the amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek, which she will be using to purchase a dairy cow and fodder along with it. “I have already four cows and I wanted to add another one to the herd to increase production, yet I could not afford it. Being one of the beneficiaries of such projects, it makes me feel good in a way and will give me the opportunity to fulfill my wish,” she said.

Fine is in her late 50s and lives in rural south central Albania with her family, which includes her husband and two children. Just like the majority of people who live in rural areas and find it easy to run a small agriculture/livestock business, she has been on the same path as well for almost four years. Her clients are the locals of a major city not far from where she lives.

Fine is very appreciative to WVA, VFA and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow and fodder.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina wants to buy a dairy cow and fodder for her animals as well as to repair her existing stable with this integrated project loan.

Kristina is a 51-year-old married mother of two who lives in south-central Albania. She has worked in agriculture with livestock for almost two decades. Selling fresh veggies and dairy products to locals is a common activity in Albania. The villagers who want to sell leave their villages as early as 5am to arrive in the city around 6am because they want to be able to find a spot in the street to sell their products. Yet, after doing this for so long now, it seems that the spots have their names on and everyone who sells respects that.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and fodder for her animals and to repair her existing stable

loans.name: Xhensila

texts.en:
Xhensila has been excited ever since she was told that she was selected from the integration projects to be one of their beneficiaries. She has wanted to buy a dairy cow for so long, and now she has been given the opportunity to buy one. She is extremely grateful to all three organizations.

Xhensila is a 23-year-old young mother of one child who lives in rural southeastern Albania with her family. Three years ago, as a newlywed, she started running her small agriculture and livestock business in an attempt to bring home an income. Since then, she has been planting and selling vegetables and grains, and also selling a bit of dairy to the locals. “You find young people in my age leaving the rural in search of a better life, and yet, they remain jobless in the city because there are no employment opportunities. So, I decided to do something here in my village and I have no regrets,” she said.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juntos Podemos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “JUNTOS PODEMOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Matilde ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de joyas como pulseras, collares y aretes, la socia vende piedras preciosas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de joyas y piedras preciosas. La socia solicita el crédito para pulseras, collares y aretes y también piedras preciosas.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de gaseosas.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "Juntos Podemos" (Together We Can). This bank is located in a district of Cusco in the Cusco providence and region.

One partner is Matilde, who is married with two children and is 42 years old. She works in her business selling jewelry like bracelets, necklaces, and earrings. She also sells precious stones, working from 9:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has spent seven years doing this business and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her jewelry and precious stone business. She is asking for a loan for bracelets, necklaces, earrings, and precious stones.

The other members in the group dedicate themselves to the business of selling beauty products, clothing, groceries, and soft drinks.

The group is grateful to everyone who forms part of their dream through these means and they promise to complete their payments in the quotas which were established.

loans.use: buy bracelets, necklaces, earrings, and precious stones.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a display case and, also, primary materials for making pork cracklings to sell.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 31-year-old man who focuses on owning a large workshop for his business in the near future. He is applying for a loan of 80,000 KES, which he will use to buy bicycle spare parts for stocking his store. He has been in this business for three years, and this is his third loan application through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy bicycle spare parts for stocking his store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as a determined businesswoman. She is applying for a loan of 100,000 KES, which she will use to purchase chemical products for her salon. Her customers are mostly female who come and plate their hair. This is her third successive loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to purchase chemical products for her salon.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is a married man. He describes himself to be patient. He operates a general goods retail store, where he sells sugar, drinks, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in the prices of goods. He will use the 95,000 KES loan to to add stock of sugar, flour, drinks and other items. His business goal is to open more retail stores within five years. He will use the profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, flour, drinks and other items for resale.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 3 and 16 years old. She operates a green grocery where she sells tomatoes, potatoes and other vegetables. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy cabbages for resale. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She will use the profits to expand her business.This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cabbages for resale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a beauty salon, where she does cosmetic treatments and hair treatments for women. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a commercial area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be training to improve her style. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy hair weaves and hair chemicals. Her business goal is to expand her business within five years. She will use the profits to expand her business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and hair chemicals.
